<hr data-start="102" data-end="105" class="">
<h3 data-start="107" data-end="126" class=""><strong data-start="111" data-end="126">Basic Level</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="128" data-end="1590">
<li data-start="128" data-end="280" class="">
<p data-start="131" data-end="280" class=""><strong data-start="131" data-end="159">What is Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="159" data-end="162">
<em data-start="165" data-end="280">Spring Security is a powerful and customizable authentication and access-control framework for Java applications.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="282" data-end="461" class="">
<p data-start="285" data-end="461" class=""><strong data-start="285" data-end="332">How is Spring Security different from JAAS?</strong><br data-start="332" data-end="335">
<em data-start="338" data-end="461">JAAS is part of Java EE, whereas Spring Security is part of the Spring ecosystem with better integration and flexibility.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="463" data-end="649" class="">
<p data-start="466" data-end="649" class=""><strong data-start="466" data-end="516">What are the main features of Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="516" data-end="519">
<em data-start="522" data-end="649">Authentication, Authorization, Password Management, CSRF protection, Session Management, and integration with OAuth2 and JWT.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="651" data-end="789" class="">
<p data-start="654" data-end="789" class=""><strong data-start="654" data-end="699">How does Spring Security work internally?</strong><br data-start="699" data-end="702">
<em data-start="705" data-end="789">It uses servlet filters to intercept and process security logic for HTTP requests.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="791" data-end="928" class="">
<p data-start="794" data-end="928" class=""><strong data-start="794" data-end="840">What is the role of <code data-start="816" data-end="837">SecurityFilterChain</code>?</strong><br data-start="840" data-end="843">
<em data-start="846" data-end="928">It defines how incoming HTTP requests are filtered and authenticated/authorized.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="930" data-end="1056" class="">
<p data-start="933" data-end="1056" class=""><strong data-start="933" data-end="973">What is the <code data-start="947" data-end="960">UserDetails</code> interface?</strong><br data-start="973" data-end="976">
<em data-start="979" data-end="1056">It provides core user information like username, password, and authorities.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1058" data-end="1177" class="">
<p data-start="1061" data-end="1177" class=""><strong data-start="1061" data-end="1098">What is the <code data-start="1075" data-end="1095">UserDetailsService</code>?</strong><br data-start="1098" data-end="1101">
<em data-start="1104" data-end="1177">It’s a service interface used to fetch user details from a data source.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1179" data-end="1294" class="">
<p data-start="1182" data-end="1294" class=""><strong data-start="1182" data-end="1226">What is the <code data-start="1196" data-end="1213">PasswordEncoder</code> interface?</strong><br data-start="1226" data-end="1229">
<em data-start="1232" data-end="1294">It’s used to encode passwords securely (e.g., using BCrypt).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1296" data-end="1442" class="">
<p data-start="1299" data-end="1442" class=""><strong data-start="1299" data-end="1364">How to configure in-memory authentication in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="1364" data-end="1367">
<em data-start="1370" data-end="1442">Using <code data-start="1377" data-end="1405">InMemoryUserDetailsManager</code> and <code data-start="1410" data-end="1440">AuthenticationManagerBuilder</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1444" data-end="1590" class="">
<p data-start="1448" data-end="1590" class=""><strong data-start="1448" data-end="1510">How to configure Spring Security with a custom login page?</strong><br data-start="1510" data-end="1513">
<em data-start="1516" data-end="1590">Override default login using <code data-start="1546" data-end="1574">.loginPage("/customLogin")</code> in the config.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1592" data-end="1595" class="">
<h3 data-start="1597" data-end="1623" class=""><strong data-start="1601" data-end="1623">Intermediate Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="11" data-start="1625" data-end="1873">
<li data-start="1625" data-end="1822" class="">
<p data-start="1629" data-end="1822" class=""><strong data-start="1629" data-end="1682">What is CSRF? How does Spring Security handle it?</strong><br data-start="1682" data-end="1685">
<em data-start="1688" data-end="1822">CSRF is a type of attack that tricks the user into executing unwanted actions. Spring adds a CSRF token to requests to prevent this.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1824" data-end="1873" class="">
<p data-start="1828" data-end="1873" class=""><strong data-start="1828" data-end="1871">How to disable CSRF in Spring Security?</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>

class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-java"><span><span>http.csrf().disable();
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<ol start="13" data-start="1919" data-end="3112">
<li data-start="1919" data-end="2089" class="">
<p data-start="1923" data-end="2089" class=""><strong data-start="1923" data-end="1989">What is the difference between <code data-start="1956" data-end="1966">@Secured</code> and <code data-start="1971" data-end="1986">@PreAuthorize</code>?</strong><br data-start="1989" data-end="1992">
<em data-start="1995" data-end="2089"><code data-start="1996" data-end="2006">@Secured</code> supports only role checks; <code data-start="2034" data-end="2049">@PreAuthorize</code> supports SpEL for complex expressions.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2091" data-end="2262" class="">
<p data-start="2095" data-end="2262" class=""><strong data-start="2095" data-end="2163">What is the difference between <code data-start="2128" data-end="2139">hasRole()</code> and <code data-start="2144" data-end="2160">hasAuthority()</code>?</strong><br data-start="2163" data-end="2166">
<em data-start="2169" data-end="2262"><code data-start="2170" data-end="2181">hasRole()</code> automatically adds "ROLE_" prefix; <code data-start="2217" data-end="2233">hasAuthority()</code> checks the exact authority.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2264" data-end="2402" class="">
<p data-start="2268" data-end="2402" class=""><strong data-start="2268" data-end="2319">How do you secure REST APIs in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="2319" data-end="2322">
<em data-start="2325" data-end="2402">Use stateless authentication with JWT, configure HTTP security accordingly.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2404" data-end="2576" class="">
<p data-start="2408" data-end="2576" class=""><strong data-start="2408" data-end="2473">How to implement JWT-based authentication in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="2473" data-end="2476">
<em data-start="2479" data-end="2576">Intercept requests using filters, validate JWT, extract user details and authenticate manually.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2578" data-end="2721" class="">
<p data-start="2582" data-end="2721" class=""><strong data-start="2582" data-end="2620">How to define multiple user roles?</strong><br data-start="2620" data-end="2623">
<em data-start="2626" data-end="2721">Assign roles/authorities in the user object and secure endpoints with <code data-start="2697" data-end="2719">hasRole("ROLE_NAME")</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2723" data-end="2859" class="">
<p data-start="2727" data-end="2859" class=""><strong data-start="2727" data-end="2786">How does method-level security work in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="2786" data-end="2789">
<em data-start="2792" data-end="2859">By enabling <code data-start="2805" data-end="2857">@EnableGlobalMethodSecurity(prePostEnabled = true)</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2861" data-end="2976" class="">
<p data-start="2865" data-end="2976" class=""><strong data-start="2865" data-end="2908">How to use custom <code data-start="2885" data-end="2905">UserDetailsService</code>?</strong><br data-start="2908" data-end="2911">
<em data-start="2914" data-end="2976">Implement the interface and override <code data-start="2952" data-end="2974">loadUserByUsername()</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2978" data-end="3112" class="">
<p data-start="2982" data-end="3112" class=""><strong data-start="2982" data-end="3033">How to handle access denied in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="3033" data-end="3036">
<em data-start="3039" data-end="3112">Use <code data-start="3044" data-end="3088">.exceptionHandling().accessDeniedHandler()</code> to customize behavior.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3114" data-end="3117" class="">
<h3 data-start="3119" data-end="3141" class=""><strong data-start="3123" data-end="3141">Advanced Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="21" data-start="3143" data-end="3733">
<li data-start="3143" data-end="3250" class="">
<p data-start="3147" data-end="3250" class=""><strong data-start="3147" data-end="3183">What is <code data-start="3157" data-end="3180">AuthenticationManager</code>?</strong><br data-start="3183" data-end="3186">
<em data-start="3189" data-end="3250">It is responsible for processing an authentication request.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3252" data-end="3386" class="">
<p data-start="3256" data-end="3386" class=""><strong data-start="3256" data-end="3305">What is the role of <code data-start="3278" data-end="3302">AuthenticationProvider</code>?</strong><br data-start="3305" data-end="3308">
<em data-start="3311" data-end="3386">It performs the actual authentication and returns an authenticated token.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3388" data-end="3526" class="">
<p data-start="3392" data-end="3526" class=""><strong data-start="3392" data-end="3447">How to implement a custom <code data-start="3420" data-end="3444">AuthenticationProvider</code>?</strong><br data-start="3447" data-end="3450">
<em data-start="3453" data-end="3526">Implement the interface and override <code data-start="3491" data-end="3507">authenticate()</code> and <code data-start="3512" data-end="3524">supports()</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3528" data-end="3676" class="">
<p data-start="3532" data-end="3676" class=""><strong data-start="3532" data-end="3581">What are security headers in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="3581" data-end="3584">
<em data-start="3587" data-end="3676">They are HTTP headers like XSS protection, Content-Security-Policy added automatically.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3678" data-end="3733" class="">
<p data-start="3682" data-end="3733" class=""><strong data-start="3682" data-end="3731">How to secure endpoints with different roles?</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<ol start="26" data-start="3876" data-end="4570">
<li data-start="3876" data-end="4032" class="">
<p data-start="3880" data-end="4032" class=""><strong data-start="3880" data-end="3951">What is the difference between form-based and basic authentication?</strong><br data-start="3951" data-end="3954">
<em data-start="3957" data-end="4032">Form-based shows an HTML form; basic uses browser popup and HTTP headers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4034" data-end="4178" class="">
<p data-start="4038" data-end="4178" class=""><strong data-start="4038" data-end="4075">How to handle session management?</strong><br data-start="4075" data-end="4078">
<em data-start="4081" data-end="4178">Using <code data-start="4088" data-end="4110">.sessionManagement()</code> with options like stateless, invalidSessionUrl, max sessions, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4180" data-end="4300" class="">
<p data-start="4184" data-end="4300" class=""><strong data-start="4184" data-end="4221">What is stateless authentication?</strong><br data-start="4221" data-end="4224">
<em data-start="4227" data-end="4300">No session is created; each request is authenticated (e.g., using JWT).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4302" data-end="4428" class="">
<p data-start="4306" data-end="4428" class=""><strong data-start="4306" data-end="4342">What is <code data-start="4316" data-end="4339">SecurityContextHolder</code>?</strong><br data-start="4342" data-end="4345">
<em data-start="4348" data-end="4428">It holds security context for the current thread (authenticated user details).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4430" data-end="4570" class="">
<p data-start="4434" data-end="4570" class=""><strong data-start="4434" data-end="4481">How to implement remember-me functionality?</strong><br data-start="4481" data-end="4484">
<em data-start="4487" data-end="4570">Use <code data-start="4492" data-end="4507">.rememberMe()</code> in your security config and configure token validity and key.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4572" data-end="4575" class="">
<h3 data-start="4577" data-end="4611" class=""><strong data-start="4581" data-end="4611">OAuth2 and JWT Integration</strong></h3>
<ol start="31" data-start="4613" data-end="5903">
<li data-start="4613" data-end="4756" class="">
<p data-start="4617" data-end="4756" class=""><strong data-start="4617" data-end="4661">How does Spring Security support OAuth2?</strong><br data-start="4661" data-end="4664">
<em data-start="4667" data-end="4756">Spring Security provides OAuth2 client and resource server support with configurations.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4758" data-end="4836" class="">
<p data-start="4762" data-end="4836" class=""><strong data-start="4762" data-end="4797">What are the components of JWT?</strong><br data-start="4797" data-end="4800">
<em data-start="4803" data-end="4836">Header, Payload, and Signature.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4838" data-end="4934" class="">
<p data-start="4842" data-end="4934" class=""><strong data-start="4842" data-end="4866">How to decode a JWT?</strong><br data-start="4866" data-end="4869">
<em data-start="4872" data-end="4934">Using libraries like <code data-start="4894" data-end="4911">io.jsonwebtoken</code> (JJWT) or <code data-start="4922" data-end="4932">java-jwt</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4936" data-end="5068" class="">
<p data-start="4940" data-end="5068" class=""><strong data-start="4940" data-end="4985">How to validate a JWT in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="4985" data-end="4988">
<em data-start="4991" data-end="5068">Extract token from header, parse it, and validate signature and expiration.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5070" data-end="5178" class="">
<p data-start="5074" data-end="5178" class=""><strong data-start="5074" data-end="5104">How to store roles in JWT?</strong><br data-start="5104" data-end="5107">
<em data-start="5110" data-end="5178">Add roles as claims and parse them into authorities in the filter.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5180" data-end="5314" class="">
<p data-start="5184" data-end="5314" class=""><strong data-start="5184" data-end="5235">How to integrate Keycloak with Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="5235" data-end="5238">
<em data-start="5241" data-end="5314">Use Spring Boot adapter or OpenID Connect support with Keycloak config.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5316" data-end="5446" class="">
<p data-start="5320" data-end="5446" class=""><strong data-start="5320" data-end="5377">What is the use of <code data-start="5341" data-end="5374">BearerTokenAuthenticationFilter</code>?</strong><br data-start="5377" data-end="5380">
<em data-start="5383" data-end="5446">It processes bearer tokens (like JWT) for API authentication.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5448" data-end="5572" class="">
<p data-start="5452" data-end="5572" class=""><strong data-start="5452" data-end="5482">How to refresh JWT tokens?</strong><br data-start="5482" data-end="5485">
<em data-start="5488" data-end="5572">Implement an endpoint that checks the refresh token and issues a new access token.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5574" data-end="5739" class="">
<p data-start="5578" data-end="5739" class=""><strong data-start="5578" data-end="5632">Difference between Access Token and Refresh Token?</strong><br data-start="5632" data-end="5635">
<em data-start="5638" data-end="5739">Access token is short-lived and used for requests; refresh token is used to get a new access token.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5741" data-end="5903" class="">
<p data-start="5745" data-end="5903" class=""><strong data-start="5745" data-end="5805">Can Spring Security support multi-tenant authentication?</strong><br data-start="5805" data-end="5808">
<em data-start="5811" data-end="5903">Yes, using a custom <code data-start="5832" data-end="5852">UserDetailsService</code> or different authentication providers per tenant.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5905" data-end="5908" class="">
<h3 data-start="5910" data-end="5944" class=""><strong data-start="5914" data-end="5944">Testing and Best Practices</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="5946" data-end="7203">
<li data-start="5946" data-end="6087" class="">
<p data-start="5950" data-end="6087" class=""><strong data-start="5950" data-end="5996">How to test Spring Security configuration?</strong><br data-start="5996" data-end="5999">
<em data-start="6002" data-end="6087">Use <code data-start="6007" data-end="6022">@WithMockUser</code>, <code data-start="6024" data-end="6042">@WithUserDetails</code>, or <code data-start="6047" data-end="6085">SecurityMockMvcRequestPostProcessors</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6089" data-end="6207" class="">
<p data-start="6093" data-end="6207" class=""><strong data-start="6093" data-end="6140">What is <code data-start="6103" data-end="6137">SecurityContextPersistenceFilter</code>?</strong><br data-start="6140" data-end="6143">
<em data-start="6146" data-end="6207">It loads and stores the <code data-start="6171" data-end="6188">SecurityContext</code> between requests.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6209" data-end="6307" class="">
<p data-start="6213" data-end="6307" class=""><strong data-start="6213" data-end="6244">What is <code data-start="6223" data-end="6241">GrantedAuthority</code>?</strong><br data-start="6244" data-end="6247">
<em data-start="6250" data-end="6307">It represents a permission or role granted to the user.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6309" data-end="6446" class="">
<p data-start="6313" data-end="6446" class=""><strong data-start="6313" data-end="6367">How to secure static resources in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="6367" data-end="6370">
<em data-start="6373" data-end="6446">Exclude them using <code data-start="6393" data-end="6444">.requestMatchers("/css/**", "/js/**").permitAll()</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6448" data-end="6550" class="">
<p data-start="6452" data-end="6550" class=""><strong data-start="6452" data-end="6497">How to allow access to specific IPs only?</strong><br data-start="6497" data-end="6500">
<em data-start="6503" data-end="6550">Use <code data-start="6508" data-end="6540">hasIpAddress("192.168.1.0/24")</code> in SpEL.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6552" data-end="6668" class="">
<p data-start="6556" data-end="6668" class=""><strong data-start="6556" data-end="6598">How to handle CORS in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="6598" data-end="6601">
<em data-start="6604" data-end="6668">Use <code data-start="6609" data-end="6622">http.cors()</code> and define a <code data-start="6636" data-end="6661">CorsConfigurationSource</code> bean.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6670" data-end="6813" class="">
<p data-start="6674" data-end="6813" class=""><strong data-start="6674" data-end="6730">What is XSS and how does Spring Security prevent it?</strong><br data-start="6730" data-end="6733">
<em data-start="6736" data-end="6813">Cross-site scripting attack; Spring uses HTTP headers and input validation.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6815" data-end="6934" class="">
<p data-start="6819" data-end="6934" class=""><strong data-start="6819" data-end="6866">How to use multiple <code data-start="6841" data-end="6862">SecurityFilterChain</code>s?</strong><br data-start="6866" data-end="6869">
<em data-start="6872" data-end="6934">Define beans with <code data-start="6891" data-end="6899">@Order</code> annotations for each URL pattern.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6936" data-end="7076" class="">
<p data-start="6940" data-end="7076" class=""><strong data-start="6940" data-end="7006">How to implement two-factor authentication in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="7006" data-end="7009">
<em data-start="7012" data-end="7076">Custom filter or flow after login to verify OTP or email code.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="7078" data-end="7203" class="">
<p data-start="7082" data-end="7203" class=""><strong data-start="7082" data-end="7140">What is the default login endpoint in Spring Security?</strong><br data-start="7140" data-end="7143">
<em data-start="7146" data-end="7203"><code data-start="7147" data-end="7155">/login</code> is the default login URL for form-based login.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="7205" data-end="7208" class="">

text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="111" class="">Great! Here's a list of <strong data-start="24" data-end="78">50 multithreading interview questions with answers</strong>, ranging from basic to advanced:</p>
<hr data-start="113" data-end="116" class="">
<h3 data-start="118" data-end="137" class=""><strong data-start="122" data-end="137">Basic Level</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="139" data-end="1351">
<li data-start="139" data-end="248" class="">
<p data-start="142" data-end="248" class=""><strong data-start="142" data-end="171">What is a thread in Java?</strong><br data-start="171" data-end="174">
<em data-start="177" data-end="248">A thread is a lightweight subprocess, the smallest unit of execution.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="250" data-end="400" class="">
<p data-start="253" data-end="400" class=""><strong data-start="253" data-end="307">What is the difference between process and thread?</strong><br data-start="307" data-end="310">
<em data-start="313" data-end="400">A process is an independent program, whereas a thread is a smaller part of a process.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="402" data-end="518" class="">
<p data-start="405" data-end="518" class=""><strong data-start="405" data-end="445">How can you create a thread in Java?</strong><br data-start="445" data-end="448">
<em data-start="451" data-end="518">By extending <code data-start="465" data-end="473">Thread</code> class or implementing <code data-start="496" data-end="506">Runnable</code> interface.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="520" data-end="660" class="">
<p data-start="523" data-end="660" class=""><strong data-start="523" data-end="567">Which is better: <code data-start="542" data-end="552">Runnable</code> or <code data-start="556" data-end="564">Thread</code>?</strong><br data-start="567" data-end="570">
<em data-start="573" data-end="660"><code data-start="574" data-end="584">Runnable</code> is better for reusability and when multiple threads share the same object.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="662" data-end="767" class="">
<p data-start="665" data-end="767" class=""><strong data-start="665" data-end="703">What is the lifecycle of a thread?</strong><br data-start="703" data-end="706">
<em data-start="709" data-end="767">New → Runnable → Running → Waiting/Blocked → Terminated.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="769" data-end="878" class="">
<p data-start="772" data-end="878" class=""><strong data-start="772" data-end="806">What does <code data-start="784" data-end="793">start()</code> method do?</strong><br data-start="806" data-end="809">
<em data-start="812" data-end="878">It creates a new thread and calls the <code data-start="851" data-end="858">run()</code> method internally.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="880" data-end="1006" class="">
<p data-start="883" data-end="1006" class=""><strong data-start="883" data-end="950">What happens if you call <code data-start="910" data-end="917">run()</code> directly instead of <code data-start="938" data-end="947">start()</code>?</strong><br data-start="950" data-end="953">
<em data-start="956" data-end="1006">It runs in the current thread, not in a new one.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1008" data-end="1118" class="">
<p data-start="1011" data-end="1118" class=""><strong data-start="1011" data-end="1051">What is the use of <code data-start="1032" data-end="1048">Thread.sleep()</code>?</strong><br data-start="1051" data-end="1054">
<em data-start="1057" data-end="1118">It pauses the execution of the thread for a specified time.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1120" data-end="1254" class="">
<p data-start="1123" data-end="1254" class=""><strong data-start="1123" data-end="1152">What is <code data-start="1133" data-end="1149">Thread.yield()</code>?</strong><br data-start="1152" data-end="1155">
<em data-start="1158" data-end="1254">It hints the scheduler that the current thread is willing to yield its current use of the CPU.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1256" data-end="1351" class="">
<p data-start="1260" data-end="1351" class=""><strong data-start="1260" data-end="1288">What is <code data-start="1270" data-end="1285">Thread.join()</code>?</strong><br data-start="1288" data-end="1291">
<em data-start="1294" data-end="1351">It waits for a thread to die before proceeding further.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1353" data-end="1356" class="">
<h3 data-start="1358" data-end="1384" class=""><strong data-start="1362" data-end="1384">Intermediate Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="11" data-start="1386" data-end="2670">
<li data-start="1386" data-end="1509" class="">
<p data-start="1390" data-end="1509" class=""><strong data-start="1390" data-end="1426">What is synchronization in Java?</strong><br data-start="1426" data-end="1429">
<em data-start="1432" data-end="1509">It’s a mechanism to control access to shared resources by multiple threads.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1511" data-end="1618" class="">
<p data-start="1515" data-end="1618" class=""><strong data-start="1515" data-end="1548">What is a synchronized block?</strong><br data-start="1548" data-end="1551">
<em data-start="1554" data-end="1618">A block of code that is locked on a particular object monitor.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1620" data-end="1783" class="">
<p data-start="1624" data-end="1783" class=""><strong data-start="1624" data-end="1702">What is the difference between synchronized method and synchronized block?</strong><br data-start="1702" data-end="1705">
<em data-start="1708" data-end="1783">Method locks the entire method; block locks a specific section or object.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1785" data-end="1901" class="">
<p data-start="1789" data-end="1901" class=""><strong data-start="1789" data-end="1812">What is a deadlock?</strong><br data-start="1812" data-end="1815">
<em data-start="1818" data-end="1901">A condition where two or more threads are blocked forever, waiting on each other.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1903" data-end="2010" class="">
<p data-start="1907" data-end="2010" class=""><strong data-start="1907" data-end="1935">How to prevent deadlock?</strong><br data-start="1935" data-end="1938">
<em data-start="1941" data-end="2010">Avoid nested locks, use lock ordering, or use tryLock with timeout.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2012" data-end="2136" class="">
<p data-start="2016" data-end="2136" class=""><strong data-start="2016" data-end="2043">What is race condition?</strong><br data-start="2043" data-end="2046">
<em data-start="2049" data-end="2136">When two threads access shared data at the same time, leading to unexpected behavior.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2138" data-end="2249" class="">
<p data-start="2142" data-end="2249" class=""><strong data-start="2142" data-end="2180">What is reentrant synchronization?</strong><br data-start="2180" data-end="2183">
<em data-start="2186" data-end="2249">It allows the thread to acquire the same lock multiple times.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2251" data-end="2366" class="">
<p data-start="2255" data-end="2366" class=""><strong data-start="2255" data-end="2297">What is the use of <code data-start="2276" data-end="2286">volatile</code> keyword?</strong><br data-start="2297" data-end="2300">
<em data-start="2303" data-end="2366">It ensures visibility of changes to variables across threads.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2368" data-end="2503" class="">
<p data-start="2372" data-end="2503" class=""><strong data-start="2372" data-end="2419">What is <code data-start="2382" data-end="2397">AtomicInteger</code> and why is it used?</strong><br data-start="2419" data-end="2422">
<em data-start="2425" data-end="2503">A class that provides atomic operations on integers without synchronization.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2505" data-end="2670" class="">
<p data-start="2509" data-end="2670" class=""><strong data-start="2509" data-end="2555">Difference between <code data-start="2530" data-end="2538">wait()</code> and <code data-start="2543" data-end="2552">sleep()</code>?</strong><br data-start="2555" data-end="2558">
<em data-start="2561" data-end="2670"><code data-start="2562" data-end="2570">wait()</code> releases the lock and is used for communication between threads; <code data-start="2636" data-end="2645">sleep()</code> just pauses the thread.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2672" data-end="2675" class="">
<h3 data-start="2677" data-end="2706" class=""><strong data-start="2681" data-end="2706">Concurrency Utilities</strong></h3>
<ol start="21" data-start="2708" data-end="3881">
<li data-start="2708" data-end="2854" class="">
<p data-start="2712" data-end="2854" class=""><strong data-start="2712" data-end="2759">What is the <code data-start="2726" data-end="2748">java.util.concurrent</code> package?</strong><br data-start="2759" data-end="2762">
<em data-start="2765" data-end="2854">It contains concurrency utilities like ExecutorService, CountDownLatch, Semaphore, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2856" data-end="2967" class="">
<p data-start="2860" data-end="2967" class=""><strong data-start="2860" data-end="2890">What is <code data-start="2870" data-end="2887">ExecutorService</code>?</strong><br data-start="2890" data-end="2893">
<em data-start="2896" data-end="2967">A high-level replacement for managing thread lifecycle and execution.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2969" data-end="3090" class="">
<p data-start="2973" data-end="3090" class=""><strong data-start="2973" data-end="3013">How to create a thread pool in Java?</strong><br data-start="3013" data-end="3016">
<em data-start="3019" data-end="3090">Using <code data-start="3026" data-end="3058">Executors.newFixedThreadPool()</code>, <code data-start="3060" data-end="3083">newCachedThreadPool()</code>, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3092" data-end="3216" class="">
<p data-start="3096" data-end="3216" class=""><strong data-start="3096" data-end="3133">What is <code data-start="3106" data-end="3116">Callable</code> vs <code data-start="3120" data-end="3130">Runnable</code>?</strong><br data-start="3133" data-end="3136">
<em data-start="3139" data-end="3216"><code data-start="3140" data-end="3150">Callable</code> returns a value and can throw an exception; <code data-start="3195" data-end="3205">Runnable</code> does not.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3218" data-end="3312" class="">
<p data-start="3222" data-end="3312" class=""><strong data-start="3222" data-end="3251">What is <code data-start="3232" data-end="3240">Future</code> in Java?</strong><br data-start="3251" data-end="3254">
<em data-start="3257" data-end="3312">Represents the result of an asynchronous computation.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3314" data-end="3445" class="">
<p data-start="3318" data-end="3445" class=""><strong data-start="3318" data-end="3347">What is <code data-start="3328" data-end="3344">CountDownLatch</code>?</strong><br data-start="3347" data-end="3350">
<em data-start="3353" data-end="3445">A synchronization aid that allows threads to wait until a set of operations are completed.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3447" data-end="3573" class="">
<p data-start="3451" data-end="3573" class=""><strong data-start="3451" data-end="3479">What is <code data-start="3461" data-end="3476">CyclicBarrier</code>?</strong><br data-start="3479" data-end="3482">
<em data-start="3485" data-end="3573">A barrier that allows a set of threads to wait for each other to reach a common point.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3575" data-end="3675" class="">
<p data-start="3579" data-end="3675" class=""><strong data-start="3579" data-end="3603">What is <code data-start="3589" data-end="3600">Semaphore</code>?</strong><br data-start="3603" data-end="3606">
<em data-start="3609" data-end="3675">Controls access to a resource by multiple threads using permits.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3677" data-end="3784" class="">
<p data-start="3681" data-end="3784" class=""><strong data-start="3681" data-end="3709">What is <code data-start="3691" data-end="3706">ReentrantLock</code>?</strong><br data-start="3709" data-end="3712">
<em data-start="3715" data-end="3784">An explicit lock with more control compared to synchronized blocks.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3786" data-end="3881" class="">
<p data-start="3790" data-end="3881" class=""><strong data-start="3790" data-end="3818">What is <code data-start="3800" data-end="3815">ReadWriteLock</code>?</strong><br data-start="3818" data-end="3821">
<em data-start="3824" data-end="3881">Allows multiple readers or one writer thread at a time.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3883" data-end="3886" class="">
<h3 data-start="3888" data-end="3910" class=""><strong data-start="3892" data-end="3910">Advanced Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="31" data-start="3912" data-end="5140">
<li data-start="3912" data-end="4021" class="">
<p data-start="3916" data-end="4021" class=""><strong data-start="3916" data-end="3946">What is thread starvation?</strong><br data-start="3946" data-end="3949">
<em data-start="3952" data-end="4021">When a thread is unable to gain regular access to shared resources.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4023" data-end="4147" class="">
<p data-start="4027" data-end="4147" class=""><strong data-start="4027" data-end="4063">What is thread priority in Java?</strong><br data-start="4063" data-end="4066">
<em data-start="4069" data-end="4147">A hint to the thread scheduler about the importance of the thread (1 to 10).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4149" data-end="4219" class="">
<p data-start="4153" data-end="4219" class=""><strong data-start="4153" data-end="4193">What is the default thread priority?</strong><br data-start="4193" data-end="4196">
<em data-start="4199" data-end="4219">5 (NORM_PRIORITY).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4221" data-end="4326" class="">
<p data-start="4225" data-end="4326" class=""><strong data-start="4225" data-end="4253">What is a daemon thread?</strong><br data-start="4253" data-end="4256">
<em data-start="4259" data-end="4326">A background thread that dies when all user threads are finished.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4328" data-end="4424" class="">
<p data-start="4332" data-end="4424" class=""><strong data-start="4332" data-end="4366">How to create a daemon thread?</strong><br data-start="4366" data-end="4369">
<em data-start="4372" data-end="4424">Call <code data-start="4378" data-end="4395">setDaemon(true)</code> before starting the thread.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4426" data-end="4581" class="">
<p data-start="4430" data-end="4581" class=""><strong data-start="4430" data-end="4488">What is the difference between live lock and deadlock?</strong><br data-start="4488" data-end="4491">
<em data-start="4494" data-end="4581">In live lock, threads keep changing state in response to each other without progress.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4583" data-end="4748" class="">
<p data-start="4587" data-end="4748" class=""><strong data-start="4587" data-end="4671">What is the difference between Thread and Runnable in terms of resource sharing?</strong><br data-start="4671" data-end="4674">
<em data-start="4677" data-end="4748">Runnable can be shared between multiple threads; Thread class cannot.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4750" data-end="4873" class="">
<p data-start="4754" data-end="4873" class=""><strong data-start="4754" data-end="4799">What are thread-safe collections in Java?</strong><br data-start="4799" data-end="4802">
<em data-start="4805" data-end="4873">Collections like <code data-start="4823" data-end="4842">ConcurrentHashMap</code>, <code data-start="4844" data-end="4866">CopyOnWriteArrayList</code>, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4875" data-end="4987" class="">
<p data-start="4879" data-end="4987" class=""><strong data-start="4879" data-end="4913">What is <code data-start="4889" data-end="4902">ThreadLocal</code> in Java?</strong><br data-start="4913" data-end="4916">
<em data-start="4919" data-end="4987">It provides thread-local variables — each thread has its own copy.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4989" data-end="5140" class="">
<p data-start="4993" data-end="5140" class=""><strong data-start="4993" data-end="5064">What is the difference between <code data-start="5026" data-end="5040">synchronized</code> and <code data-start="5045" data-end="5051">Lock</code> interface?</strong><br data-start="5064" data-end="5067">
<em data-start="5070" data-end="5140"><code data-start="5071" data-end="5077">Lock</code> offers more flexibility (e.g., tryLock, interruptible locks).</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5142" data-end="5145" class="">
<h3 data-start="5147" data-end="5189" class=""><strong data-start="5151" data-end="5189">Best Practices and Design Patterns</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="5191" data-end="6499">
<li data-start="5191" data-end="5310" class="">
<p data-start="5195" data-end="5310" class=""><strong data-start="5195" data-end="5235">How to handle exceptions in threads?</strong><br data-start="5235" data-end="5238">
<em data-start="5241" data-end="5310">Use <code data-start="5246" data-end="5284">Thread.setUncaughtExceptionHandler()</code> or try-catch in <code data-start="5301" data-end="5308">run()</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5312" data-end="5431" class="">
<p data-start="5316" data-end="5431" class=""><strong data-start="5316" data-end="5358">What is the Producer-Consumer problem?</strong><br data-start="5358" data-end="5361">
<em data-start="5364" data-end="5431">A classic example of a multi-threading problem using wait-notify.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5433" data-end="5554" class="">
<p data-start="5437" data-end="5554" class=""><strong data-start="5437" data-end="5473">What is the Fork/Join framework?</strong><br data-start="5473" data-end="5476">
<em data-start="5479" data-end="5554">Used for parallel processing by breaking tasks into subtasks recursively.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5556" data-end="5710" class="">
<p data-start="5560" data-end="5710" class=""><strong data-start="5560" data-end="5605">What is the double-checked locking idiom?</strong><br data-start="5605" data-end="5608">
<em data-start="5611" data-end="5710">A pattern to reduce the overhead of acquiring a lock by first checking condition without locking.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5712" data-end="5848" class="">
<p data-start="5716" data-end="5848" class=""><strong data-start="5716" data-end="5769">What is the significance of <code data-start="5746" data-end="5753">final</code> with threads?</strong><br data-start="5769" data-end="5772">
<em data-start="5775" data-end="5848">Makes variables thread-safe by ensuring they are initialized only once.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5850" data-end="5995" class="">
<p data-start="5854" data-end="5995" class=""><strong data-start="5854" data-end="5880">What is false sharing?</strong><br data-start="5880" data-end="5883">
<em data-start="5886" data-end="5995">When threads on different processors modify variables close together in memory, causing cache invalidation.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5997" data-end="6099" class="">
<p data-start="6001" data-end="6099" class=""><strong data-start="6001" data-end="6039">How to make Singleton thread-safe?</strong><br data-start="6039" data-end="6042">
<em data-start="6045" data-end="6099">Using synchronized, eager initialization, or <code data-start="6091" data-end="6097">enum</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6101" data-end="6206" class="">
<p data-start="6105" data-end="6206" class=""><strong data-start="6105" data-end="6130">What is busy waiting?</strong><br data-start="6130" data-end="6133">
<em data-start="6136" data-end="6206">When a thread continuously checks a condition without releasing CPU.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6208" data-end="6357" class="">
<p data-start="6212" data-end="6357" class=""><strong data-start="6212" data-end="6269">What are interruptible and non-interruptible methods?</strong><br data-start="6269" data-end="6272">
<em data-start="6275" data-end="6357">Methods like <code data-start="6289" data-end="6298">sleep()</code>, <code data-start="6300" data-end="6308">wait()</code> are interruptible; synchronized blocks are not.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6359" data-end="6499" class="">
<p data-start="6363" data-end="6499" class=""><strong data-start="6363" data-end="6410">Why should you avoid using <code data-start="6392" data-end="6407">Thread.stop()</code>?</strong><br data-start="6410" data-end="6413">
<em data-start="6416" data-end="6499">It is unsafe and deprecated as it can leave shared data in an inconsistent state.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="6501" data-end="6504" class="">
<p data-start="6506" data-end="6620" class="">Let me know if you'd like a version tailored to real-world coding examples or interview problem-solving empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="90" class="">Here are <strong data-start="9" data-end="57">50 REST API interview questions with answers</strong>, from basics to advanced levels:</p>
<hr data-start="92" data-end="95" class="">
<h3 data-start="97" data-end="116" class=""><strong data-start="101" data-end="116">Basic Level</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="118" data-end="1197">
<li data-start="118" data-end="265" class="">
<p data-start="121" data-end="265" class=""><strong data-start="121" data-end="144">What is a REST API?</strong><br data-start="144" data-end="147">
<em data-start="150" data-end="265">REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style for designing networked applications using HTTP.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="267" data-end="356" class="">
<p data-start="270" data-end="356" class=""><strong data-start="270" data-end="318">What are the main HTTP methods used in REST?</strong><br data-start="318" data-end="321">
<em data-start="324" data-end="356">GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="358" data-end="495" class="">
<p data-start="361" data-end="495" class=""><strong data-start="361" data-end="410">What is the difference between PUT and PATCH?</strong><br data-start="410" data-end="413">
<em data-start="416" data-end="495">PUT replaces the entire resource, while PATCH updates a part of the resource.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="497" data-end="610" class="">
<p data-start="500" data-end="610" class=""><strong data-start="500" data-end="548">What is the difference between GET and POST?</strong><br data-start="548" data-end="551">
<em data-start="554" data-end="610">GET retrieves data; POST submits data to be processed.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="612" data-end="718" class="">
<p data-start="615" data-end="718" class=""><strong data-start="615" data-end="646">What are resources in REST?</strong><br data-start="646" data-end="649">
<em data-start="652" data-end="718">Resources are entities (e.g., User, Product) identified by URIs.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="720" data-end="805" class="">
<p data-start="723" data-end="805" class=""><strong data-start="723" data-end="741">What is a URI?</strong><br data-start="741" data-end="744">
<em data-start="747" data-end="805">Uniform Resource Identifier – the address of a resource.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="807" data-end="930" class="">
<p data-start="810" data-end="930" class=""><strong data-start="810" data-end="857">What is the difference between URI and URL?</strong><br data-start="857" data-end="860">
<em data-start="863" data-end="930">URL is a type of URI that includes location (protocol + address).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="932" data-end="1063" class="">
<p data-start="935" data-end="1063" class=""><strong data-start="935" data-end="959">What is Idempotency?</strong><br data-start="959" data-end="962">
<em data-start="965" data-end="1063">An operation is idempotent if it produces the same result no matter how many times it is called.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1065" data-end="1141" class="">
<p data-start="1068" data-end="1141" class=""><strong data-start="1068" data-end="1106">Which HTTP methods are idempotent?</strong><br data-start="1106" data-end="1109">
<em data-start="1112" data-end="1141">GET, PUT, DELETE, and HEAD.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1143" data-end="1197" class="">
<p data-start="1147" data-end="1197" class=""><strong data-start="1147" data-end="1182">What status code means success?</strong><br data-start="1182" data-end="1185">
<em data-start="1188" data-end="1197">200 OK.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1199" data-end="1202" class="">
<h3 data-start="1204" data-end="1230" class=""><strong data-start="1208" data-end="1230">Intermediate Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="11" data-start="1232" data-end="2424">
<li data-start="1232" data-end="1320" class="">
<p data-start="1236" data-end="1320" class=""><strong data-start="1236" data-end="1267">What does 201 Created mean?</strong><br data-start="1267" data-end="1270">
<em data-start="1273" data-end="1320">A new resource has been created successfully.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1322" data-end="1429" class="">
<p data-start="1326" data-end="1429" class=""><strong data-start="1326" data-end="1360">What does 204 No Content mean?</strong><br data-start="1360" data-end="1363">
<em data-start="1366" data-end="1429">The request was successful but there is no content to return.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1431" data-end="1538" class="">
<p data-start="1435" data-end="1538" class=""><strong data-start="1435" data-end="1482">What is the difference between 400 and 404?</strong><br data-start="1482" data-end="1485">
<em data-start="1488" data-end="1538">400 is a bad request; 404 is resource not found.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1540" data-end="1641" class="">
<p data-start="1544" data-end="1641" class=""><strong data-start="1544" data-end="1582">What is 500 Internal Server Error?</strong><br data-start="1582" data-end="1585">
<em data-start="1588" data-end="1641">A generic error when the server fails unexpectedly.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1643" data-end="1779" class="">
<p data-start="1647" data-end="1779" class=""><strong data-start="1647" data-end="1667">What is HATEOAS?</strong><br data-start="1667" data-end="1670">
<em data-start="1673" data-end="1779">Hypermedia as the Engine of Application State – REST responses contain links to other actions/resources.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1781" data-end="1922" class="">
<p data-start="1785" data-end="1922" class=""><strong data-start="1785" data-end="1825">What is content negotiation in REST?</strong><br data-start="1825" data-end="1828">
<em data-start="1831" data-end="1922">Allows clients to request specific content types (like JSON, XML) using <code data-start="1904" data-end="1912">Accept</code> headers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1924" data-end="2057" class="">
<p data-start="1928" data-end="2057" class=""><strong data-start="1928" data-end="1974">How do you handle versioning in REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="1974" data-end="1977">
<em data-start="1980" data-end="2057">Via URI (e.g., <code data-start="1996" data-end="2007">/v1/users</code>), headers, query params, or content negotiation.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2059" data-end="2176" class="">
<p data-start="2063" data-end="2176" class=""><strong data-start="2063" data-end="2089">What are HTTP headers?</strong><br data-start="2089" data-end="2092">
<em data-start="2095" data-end="2176">Metadata sent with HTTP requests/responses (e.g., Content-Type, Authorization).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2178" data-end="2344" class="">
<p data-start="2182" data-end="2344" class=""><strong data-start="2182" data-end="2251">What is the difference between synchronous and asynchronous APIs?</strong><br data-start="2251" data-end="2254">
<em data-start="2257" data-end="2344">Synchronous waits for a response; asynchronous returns immediately and handles later.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2346" data-end="2424" class="">
<p data-start="2350" data-end="2424" class=""><strong data-start="2350" data-end="2378">What is OpenAPI/Swagger?</strong><br data-start="2378" data-end="2381">
<em data-start="2384" data-end="2424">A tool to document and test REST APIs.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2426" data-end="2429" class="">
<h3 data-start="2431" data-end="2468" class=""><strong data-start="2435" data-end="2468">Spring Boot REST API Specific</strong></h3>
<ol start="21" data-start="2470" data-end="3472">
<li data-start="2470" data-end="2568" class="">
<p data-start="2474" data-end="2568" class=""><strong data-start="2474" data-end="2525">How to create a REST controller in Spring Boot?</strong><br data-start="2525" data-end="2528">
<em data-start="2531" data-end="2568">Using <code data-start="2538" data-end="2555">@RestController</code> annotation.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2570" data-end="2682" class="">
<p data-start="2574" data-end="2682" class=""><strong data-start="2574" data-end="2614">How to map a request in Spring Boot?</strong><br data-start="2614" data-end="2617">
<em data-start="2620" data-end="2682">Using <code data-start="2627" data-end="2644">@RequestMapping</code>, <code data-start="2646" data-end="2659">@GetMapping</code>, <code data-start="2661" data-end="2675">@PostMapping</code>, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2684" data-end="2775" class="">
<p data-start="2688" data-end="2775" class=""><strong data-start="2688" data-end="2728">How to get data from URL parameters?</strong><br data-start="2728" data-end="2731">
<em data-start="2734" data-end="2775">Use <code data-start="2739" data-end="2754">@PathVariable</code> or <code data-start="2758" data-end="2773">@RequestParam</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2777" data-end="2852" class="">
<p data-start="2781" data-end="2852" class=""><strong data-start="2781" data-end="2825">How to send data in a POST request body?</strong><br data-start="2825" data-end="2828">
<em data-start="2831" data-end="2852">Use <code data-start="2836" data-end="2850">@RequestBody</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2854" data-end="2926" class="">
<p data-start="2858" data-end="2926" class=""><strong data-start="2858" data-end="2897">How to return a custom HTTP status?</strong><br data-start="2897" data-end="2900">
<em data-start="2903" data-end="2926">Use <code data-start="2908" data-end="2924">ResponseEntity</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2928" data-end="3030" class="">
<p data-start="2932" data-end="3030" class=""><strong data-start="2932" data-end="2973">What is <code data-start="2942" data-end="2961">@ExceptionHandler</code> used for?</strong><br data-start="2973" data-end="2976">
<em data-start="2979" data-end="3030">To handle exceptions globally or in a controller.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3032" data-end="3132" class="">
<p data-start="3036" data-end="3132" class=""><strong data-start="3036" data-end="3078">What is the purpose of <code data-start="3061" data-end="3075">@CrossOrigin</code>?</strong><br data-start="3078" data-end="3081">
<em data-start="3084" data-end="3132">To allow cross-origin requests (CORS support).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3134" data-end="3278" class="">
<p data-start="3138" data-end="3278" class=""><strong data-start="3138" data-end="3209">What is the difference between <code data-start="3171" data-end="3188">@RestController</code> and <code data-start="3193" data-end="3206">@Controller</code>?</strong><br data-start="3209" data-end="3212">
<em data-start="3215" data-end="3278"><code data-start="3216" data-end="3233">@RestController</code> = <code data-start="3236" data-end="3265">@Controller + @ResponseBody</code> by default.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3280" data-end="3392" class="">
<p data-start="3284" data-end="3392" class=""><strong data-start="3284" data-end="3332">How to validate request data in Spring Boot?</strong><br data-start="3332" data-end="3335">
<em data-start="3338" data-end="3392">Use JSR-303 annotations like <code data-start="3368" data-end="3376">@Valid</code> or <code data-start="3380" data-end="3390">@NotNull</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3394" data-end="3472" class="">
<p data-start="3398" data-end="3472" class=""><strong data-start="3398" data-end="3426">How to secure REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="3426" data-end="3429">
<em data-start="3432" data-end="3472">Using Spring Security + JWT or OAuth2.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3474" data-end="3477" class="">
<h3 data-start="3479" data-end="3501" class=""><strong data-start="3483" data-end="3501">Advanced Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="31" data-start="3503" data-end="4735">
<li data-start="3503" data-end="3661" class="">
<p data-start="3507" data-end="3661" class=""><strong data-start="3507" data-end="3559">What are best practices for designing REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="3559" data-end="3562">
<em data-start="3565" data-end="3661">Use nouns for resources, version your API, handle errors properly, use HTTP methods correctly.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3663" data-end="3791" class="">
<p data-start="3667" data-end="3791" class=""><strong data-start="3667" data-end="3716">What is pagination and how is it implemented?</strong><br data-start="3716" data-end="3719">
<em data-start="3722" data-end="3791">Breaking data into pages using query params like <code data-start="3772" data-end="3789">?page=1&amp;size=10</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3793" data-end="3906" class="">
<p data-start="3797" data-end="3906" class=""><strong data-start="3797" data-end="3823">What is rate limiting?</strong><br data-start="3823" data-end="3826">
<em data-start="3829" data-end="3906">Restricting the number of requests a client can make in a given time frame.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3908" data-end="3998" class="">
<p data-start="3912" data-end="3998" class=""><strong data-start="3912" data-end="3935">What is throttling?</strong><br data-start="3935" data-end="3938">
<em data-start="3941" data-end="3998">Controlling the usage of APIs for each user or service.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4000" data-end="4130" class="">
<p data-start="4004" data-end="4130" class=""><strong data-start="4004" data-end="4042">How to handle errors in REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="4042" data-end="4045">
<em data-start="4048" data-end="4130">Use consistent error response format with appropriate status codes and messages.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4132" data-end="4267" class="">
<p data-start="4136" data-end="4267" class=""><strong data-start="4136" data-end="4187">What are common status codes for client errors?</strong><br data-start="4187" data-end="4190">
<em data-start="4193" data-end="4267">400 (Bad Request), 401 (Unauthorized), 403 (Forbidden), 404 (Not Found).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4269" data-end="4416" class="">
<p data-start="4273" data-end="4416" class=""><strong data-start="4273" data-end="4321">What is JWT and how is it used in REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="4321" data-end="4324">
<em data-start="4327" data-end="4416">JWT (JSON Web Token) is used for stateless authentication by passing tokens in headers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4418" data-end="4530" class="">
<p data-start="4422" data-end="4530" class=""><strong data-start="4422" data-end="4449">What is an API gateway?</strong><br data-start="4449" data-end="4452">
<em data-start="4455" data-end="4530">A single entry point for all clients to access backend services securely.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4532" data-end="4611" class="">
<p data-start="4536" data-end="4611" class=""><strong data-start="4536" data-end="4562">How to test REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="4562" data-end="4565">
<em data-start="4568" data-end="4611">Use tools like Postman, curl, Swagger UI.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4613" data-end="4735" class="">
<p data-start="4617" data-end="4735" class=""><strong data-start="4617" data-end="4653">How do you cache REST responses?</strong><br data-start="4653" data-end="4656">
<em data-start="4659" data-end="4735">Use HTTP headers like <code data-start="4682" data-end="4697">Cache-Control</code>, <code data-start="4699" data-end="4705">ETag</code>, or use server-side caching.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4737" data-end="4740" class="">
<h3 data-start="4742" data-end="4769" class=""><strong data-start="4746" data-end="4769">Real-World &amp; Design</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="4771" data-end="6146">
<li data-start="4771" data-end="4893" class="">
<p data-start="4775" data-end="4893" class=""><strong data-start="4775" data-end="4823">How do you handle file uploads in REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="4823" data-end="4826">
<em data-start="4829" data-end="4893">Use <code data-start="4834" data-end="4876">@RequestParam("file") MultipartFile file</code> in Spring Boot.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4895" data-end="5004" class="">
<p data-start="4899" data-end="5004" class=""><strong data-start="4899" data-end="4949">How do you handle authentication in REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="4949" data-end="4952">
<em data-start="4955" data-end="5004">Using JWT, OAuth2, API Keys, or session tokens.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5006" data-end="5149" class="">
<p data-start="5010" data-end="5149" class=""><strong data-start="5010" data-end="5043">What are RESTful constraints?</strong><br data-start="5043" data-end="5046">
<em data-start="5049" data-end="5149">Client-server, stateless, cacheable, layered system, uniform interface, code on demand (optional).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5151" data-end="5274" class="">
<p data-start="5155" data-end="5274" class=""><strong data-start="5155" data-end="5192">How to make REST APIs idempotent?</strong><br data-start="5192" data-end="5195">
<em data-start="5198" data-end="5274">Avoid side effects and always return the same response for repeated calls.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5276" data-end="5390" class="">
<p data-start="5280" data-end="5390" class=""><strong data-start="5280" data-end="5329">What is HAL (Hypertext Application Language)?</strong><br data-start="5329" data-end="5332">
<em data-start="5335" data-end="5390">A format that enables linking resources in REST APIs.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5392" data-end="5544" class="">
<p data-start="5396" data-end="5544" class=""><strong data-start="5396" data-end="5440">What are the disadvantages of REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="5440" data-end="5443">
<em data-start="5446" data-end="5544">Statelessness can lead to more data sent per request, less suitable for real-time communication.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5546" data-end="5679" class="">
<p data-start="5550" data-end="5679" class=""><strong data-start="5550" data-end="5576">What is a DTO in REST?</strong><br data-start="5576" data-end="5579">
<em data-start="5582" data-end="5679">Data Transfer Object – used to transfer data between client and server, separate from entities.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5681" data-end="5793" class="">
<p data-start="5685" data-end="5793" class=""><strong data-start="5685" data-end="5732">How do you handle concurrency in REST APIs?</strong><br data-start="5732" data-end="5735">
<em data-start="5738" data-end="5793">Use optimistic locking with versioning or timestamps.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5795" data-end="5960" class="">
<p data-start="5799" data-end="5960" class=""><strong data-start="5799" data-end="5848">What are the challenges in REST API security?</strong><br data-start="5848" data-end="5851">
<em data-start="5854" data-end="5960">Token theft, injection attacks, unauthorized access – mitigate with HTTPS, validation, security headers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5962" data-end="6146" class="">
<p data-start="5966" data-end="6146" class=""><strong data-start="5966" data-end="6014">When should you use REST vs gRPC or GraphQL?</strong><br data-start="6014" data-end="6017">
<em data-start="6020" data-end="6146">REST is better for simplicity and web compatibility; gRPC for high-performance microservices; GraphQL for flexible querying.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="6148" data-end="6151" class="">
<p data-start="6153" data-end="6281" class="">Let me know if you’d like code examples or a version focused on Spring Boot implementation, JWT, or microservices REST patterns.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></article><article class="text-token-text-primary w-full" dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-7" data-scroll-anchor="false"><h5 class="sr-only">You said:</h5><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 px-6"><div class="mx-auto flex flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 md:max-w-3xl group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col @xs/thread:px-0 @sm/thread:px-1.5 @md/thread:px-4"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="8246cc94-811f-4c87-8c81-053bb5cb7198" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="w-full"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] bg-token-message-surface rounded-3xl px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">400 (Bad Request), 401 (Unauthorized), 403 (Forbidden), 404 (Not Found).

If authentication failed or authorization failed, what to map

Here's how to <strong data-start="30" data-end="62">map proper HTTP status codes</strong> for authentication and authorization scenarios:</p>
<hr data-start="112" data-end="115" class="">
<h3 data-start="117" data-end="171" class=""><strong data-start="121" data-end="171">1. Authentication Failure → <code data-start="151" data-end="169">401 Unauthorized</code></strong></h3>
<ul data-start="172" data-end="412">
<li data-start="172" data-end="267" class="">
<p data-start="174" data-end="267" class=""><strong data-start="174" data-end="187">Use when:</strong> The user is <strong data-start="200" data-end="221">not authenticated</strong> (e.g., missing/invalid token or credentials).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="268" data-end="341" class="">
<p data-start="270" data-end="341" class=""><strong data-start="270" data-end="282">Example:</strong> No JWT token in the request, or invalid login credentials.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="342" data-end="412" class="">
<p data-start="344" data-end="412" class=""><strong data-start="344" data-end="356">Message:</strong> <em data-start="357" data-end="384">"Authentication required"</em> or <em data-start="388" data-end="412">"Invalid credentials."</em></p>
</li>
</ul>

<hr data-start="478" data-end="481" class="">
<h3 data-start="483" data-end="533" class=""><strong data-start="487" data-end="533">2. Authorization Failure → <code data-start="516" data-end="531">403 Forbidden</code></strong></h3>
<ul data-start="534" data-end="798">
<li data-start="534" data-end="626" class="">
<p data-start="536" data-end="626" class=""><strong data-start="536" data-end="549">Use when:</strong> The user is <strong data-start="562" data-end="579">authenticated</strong> but <strong data-start="584" data-end="602">not authorized</strong> to access the resource.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="627" data-end="728" class="">
<p data-start="629" data-end="728" class=""><strong data-start="629" data-end="641">Example:</strong> JWT token is valid, but the user's role doesn't have access to the requested endpoint.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="729" data-end="798" class="">
<p data-start="731" data-end="798" class=""><strong data-start="731" data-end="743">Message:</strong> <em data-start="744" data-end="798">"You don't have permission to access this resource."</em></p>
</li>
</ul>
