break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="166" class="">Awesome! Here are <strong data-start="18" data-end="71">50 Microservices interview questions with answers</strong>, covering fundamental concepts, architecture, patterns, tools, and Spring Boot implementation:</p>
<hr data-start="168" data-end="171" class="">
<h3 data-start="173" data-end="192" class=""><strong data-start="177" data-end="192">Basic Level</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="194" data-end="979">
<li data-start="194" data-end="363" class="">
<p data-start="197" data-end="363" class=""><strong data-start="197" data-end="224">What are microservices?</strong><br data-start="224" data-end="227">
<em data-start="230" data-end="363">Microservices are an architectural style where applications are composed of small, independent services that communicate over APIs.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="365" data-end="517" class="">
<p data-start="368" data-end="517" class=""><strong data-start="368" data-end="416">What are the main benefits of microservices?</strong><br data-start="416" data-end="419">
<em data-start="422" data-end="517">Scalability, flexibility, fault isolation, independent deployments, and technology diversity.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="519" data-end="642" class="">
<p data-start="522" data-end="642" class=""><strong data-start="522" data-end="566">What are the drawbacks of microservices?</strong><br data-start="566" data-end="569">
<em data-start="572" data-end="642">Complexity in management, testing, data consistency, and deployment.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="644" data-end="859" class="">
<p data-start="647" data-end="859" class=""><strong data-start="647" data-end="724">What is the difference between monolithic and microservices architecture?</strong><br data-start="724" data-end="727">
<em data-start="730" data-end="859">Monolith: tightly coupled components in one deployable unit. Microservices: loosely coupled, independently deployable services.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="861" data-end="979" class="">
<p data-start="864" data-end="979" class=""><strong data-start="864" data-end="901">How do microservices communicate?</strong><br data-start="901" data-end="904">
<em data-start="907" data-end="979">Typically via REST, gRPC, or messaging queues (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka).</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="981" data-end="984" class="">
<h3 data-start="986" data-end="1012" class=""><strong data-start="990" data-end="1012">Intermediate Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="6" data-start="1014" data-end="1627">
<li data-start="1014" data-end="1145" class="">
<p data-start="1017" data-end="1145" class=""><strong data-start="1017" data-end="1047">What is service discovery?</strong><br data-start="1047" data-end="1050">
<em data-start="1053" data-end="1145">Mechanism to automatically detect service instances on the network (e.g., Eureka, Consul).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1147" data-end="1269" class="">
<p data-start="1150" data-end="1269" class=""><strong data-start="1150" data-end="1177">What is an API Gateway?</strong><br data-start="1177" data-end="1180">
<em data-start="1183" data-end="1269">A single entry point for all clients, handles routing, security, rate limiting, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1271" data-end="1365" class="">
<p data-start="1274" data-end="1365" class=""><strong data-start="1274" data-end="1301">Name some API Gateways.</strong><br data-start="1301" data-end="1304">
<em data-start="1307" data-end="1365">Spring Cloud Gateway, Netflix Zuul, Kong, NGINX, Apigee.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1367" data-end="1516" class="">
<p data-start="1370" data-end="1516" class=""><strong data-start="1370" data-end="1406">What is circuit breaker pattern?</strong><br data-start="1406" data-end="1409">
<em data-start="1412" data-end="1516">Prevents calls to a failing service to avoid cascading failures (e.g., Netflix Hystrix, Resilience4j).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1518" data-end="1627" class="">
<p data-start="1522" data-end="1627" class=""><strong data-start="1522" data-end="1580">What is service registry and discovery in Spring Boot?</strong><br data-start="1580" data-end="1583">
<em data-start="1586" data-end="1627">Using Netflix Eureka with Spring Cloud.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1629" data-end="1632" class="">
<h3 data-start="1634" data-end="1669" class=""><strong data-start="1638" data-end="1669">Spring Boot + Microservices</strong></h3>
<ol start="11" data-start="1671" data-end="2381">
<li data-start="1671" data-end="1851" class="">
<p data-start="1675" data-end="1851" class=""><strong data-start="1675" data-end="1732">How do you implement microservices using Spring Boot?</strong><br data-start="1732" data-end="1735">
<em data-start="1738" data-end="1851">Use Spring Boot for each service, with REST APIs, Eureka for discovery, Gateway for routing, and config server.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1853" data-end="1986" class="">
<p data-start="1857" data-end="1986" class=""><strong data-start="1857" data-end="1882">What is Spring Cloud?</strong><br data-start="1882" data-end="1885">
<em data-start="1888" data-end="1986">A collection of tools for building distributed systems like config server, Eureka, gateway, etc.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1988" data-end="2128" class="">
<p data-start="1992" data-end="2128" class=""><strong data-start="1992" data-end="2031">What is Spring Cloud Config Server?</strong><br data-start="2031" data-end="2034">
<em data-start="2037" data-end="2128">A central place to manage external properties for all services in different environments.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2130" data-end="2247" class="">
<p data-start="2134" data-end="2247" class=""><strong data-start="2134" data-end="2179">How do microservices share configuration?</strong><br data-start="2179" data-end="2182">
<em data-start="2185" data-end="2247">Via Spring Cloud Config Server backed by Git or file system.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2249" data-end="2381" class="">
<p data-start="2253" data-end="2381" class=""><strong data-start="2253" data-end="2303">How do you handle inter-service communication?</strong><br data-start="2303" data-end="2306">
<em data-start="2309" data-end="2381">REST (<code data-start="2316" data-end="2330">RestTemplate</code>, <code data-start="2332" data-end="2343">WebClient</code>) or messaging (<code data-start="2359" data-end="2369">RabbitMQ</code>, <code data-start="2371" data-end="2378">Kafka</code>).</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2383" data-end="2386" class="">
<h3 data-start="2388" data-end="2413" class=""><strong data-start="2392" data-end="2413">Advanced Concepts</strong></h3>
<ol start="16" data-start="2415" data-end="3114">
<li data-start="2415" data-end="2531" class="">
<p data-start="2419" data-end="2531" class=""><strong data-start="2419" data-end="2452">What is eventual consistency?</strong><br data-start="2452" data-end="2455">
<em data-start="2458" data-end="2531">Ensuring data is consistent across services over time, not immediately.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2533" data-end="2662" class="">
<p data-start="2537" data-end="2662" class=""><strong data-start="2537" data-end="2566">What is the Saga pattern?</strong><br data-start="2566" data-end="2569">
<em data-start="2572" data-end="2662">Manages distributed transactions using a series of local transactions with compensation.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2664" data-end="2834" class="">
<p data-start="2668" data-end="2834" class=""><strong data-start="2668" data-end="2734">What is the difference between orchestration and choreography?</strong><br data-start="2734" data-end="2737">
<em data-start="2740" data-end="2834">Orchestration uses a central coordinator; choreography relies on event-driven communication.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2836" data-end="2957" class="">
<p data-start="2840" data-end="2957" class=""><strong data-start="2840" data-end="2893">How to implement authentication in microservices?</strong><br data-start="2893" data-end="2896">
<em data-start="2899" data-end="2957">Use centralized authentication with JWT and API Gateway.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2959" data-end="3114" class="">
<p data-start="2963" data-end="3114" class=""><strong data-start="2963" data-end="3018">What is OAuth2 and how is it used in microservices?</strong><br data-start="3018" data-end="3021">
<em data-start="3024" data-end="3114">An authorization framework to access resources. Often implemented with Keycloak or Okta.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3116" data-end="3119" class="">
<h3 data-start="3121" data-end="3155" class=""><strong data-start="3125" data-end="3155">Resilience &amp; Observability</strong></h3>
<ol start="21" data-start="3157" data-end="3875">
<li data-start="3157" data-end="3270" class="">
<p data-start="3161" data-end="3270" class=""><strong data-start="3161" data-end="3186">What is Resilience4j?</strong><br data-start="3186" data-end="3189">
<em data-start="3192" data-end="3270">A lightweight fault tolerance library for Java 8 and functional programming.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3272" data-end="3413" class="">
<p data-start="3276" data-end="3413" class=""><strong data-start="3276" data-end="3320">What is load balancing in microservices?</strong><br data-start="3320" data-end="3323">
<em data-start="3326" data-end="3413">Distributing traffic across multiple instances to ensure reliability and scalability.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3415" data-end="3600" class="">
<p data-start="3419" data-end="3600" class=""><strong data-start="3419" data-end="3473">What is client-side vs server-side load balancing?</strong><br data-start="3473" data-end="3476">
<em data-start="3479" data-end="3600">Client-side (e.g., Ribbon): done by the service itself. Server-side (e.g., AWS ELB): handled by external load balancer.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3602" data-end="3760" class="">
<p data-start="3606" data-end="3760" class=""><strong data-start="3606" data-end="3658">What is rate limiting and how is it implemented?</strong><br data-start="3658" data-end="3661">
<em data-start="3664" data-end="3760">Restricting the number of API requests to prevent abuse. Use tools like Bucket4j, API Gateway.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3762" data-end="3875" class="">
<p data-start="3766" data-end="3875" class=""><strong data-start="3766" data-end="3803">How do you monitor microservices?</strong><br data-start="3803" data-end="3806">
<em data-start="3809" data-end="3875">Using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, Zipkin, Sleuth.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3877" data-end="3880" class="">
<h3 data-start="3882" data-end="3898" class=""><strong data-start="3886" data-end="3898">Security</strong></h3>
<ol start="26" data-start="3900" data-end="4487">
<li data-start="3900" data-end="4008" class="">
<p data-start="3904" data-end="4008" class=""><strong data-start="3904" data-end="3962">How do you secure communication between microservices?</strong><br data-start="3962" data-end="3965">
<em data-start="3968" data-end="4008">Use HTTPS, JWT, OAuth2, or mutual TLS.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4010" data-end="4111" class="">
<p data-start="4014" data-end="4111" class=""><strong data-start="4014" data-end="4037">What is mutual TLS?</strong><br data-start="4037" data-end="4040">
<em data-start="4043" data-end="4111">Both client and server authenticate each other using certificates.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4113" data-end="4256" class="">
<p data-start="4117" data-end="4256" class=""><strong data-start="4117" data-end="4173">How do you implement authorization in microservices?</strong><br data-start="4173" data-end="4176">
<em data-start="4179" data-end="4256">Centralized role-based access control using a token (e.g., JWT with roles).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4258" data-end="4376" class="">
<p data-start="4262" data-end="4376" class=""><strong data-start="4262" data-end="4305">How to handle secrets in microservices?</strong><br data-start="4305" data-end="4308">
<em data-start="4311" data-end="4376">Use Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or encrypted config properties.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4378" data-end="4487" class="">
<p data-start="4382" data-end="4487" class=""><strong data-start="4382" data-end="4409">What is a bearer token?</strong><br data-start="4409" data-end="4412">
<em data-start="4415" data-end="4487">A type of access token used in OAuth2 to identify the user or service.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4489" data-end="4492" class="">
<h3 data-start="4494" data-end="4521" class=""><strong data-start="4498" data-end="4521">Data and Deployment</strong></h3>
<ol start="31" data-start="4523" data-end="5131">
<li data-start="4523" data-end="4651" class="">
<p data-start="4527" data-end="4651" class=""><strong data-start="4527" data-end="4583">How do you handle data consistency in microservices?</strong><br data-start="4583" data-end="4586">
<em data-start="4589" data-end="4651">Using eventual consistency, Saga pattern, or event sourcing.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4653" data-end="4769" class="">
<p data-start="4657" data-end="4769" class=""><strong data-start="4657" data-end="4699">Should microservices share a database?</strong><br data-start="4699" data-end="4702">
<em data-start="4705" data-end="4769">No, each service should own its data to ensure loose coupling.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4771" data-end="4907" class="">
<p data-start="4775" data-end="4907" class=""><strong data-start="4775" data-end="4832">How do you perform transactions across microservices?</strong><br data-start="4832" data-end="4835">
<em data-start="4838" data-end="4907">Use Saga or two-phase commit (not recommended for high-scale apps).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4909" data-end="4999" class="">
<p data-start="4913" data-end="4999" class=""><strong data-start="4913" data-end="4949">How do you deploy microservices?</strong><br data-start="4949" data-end="4952">
<em data-start="4955" data-end="4999">Using Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5001" data-end="5131" class="">
<p data-start="5005" data-end="5131" class=""><strong data-start="5005" data-end="5030">What is service mesh?</strong><br data-start="5030" data-end="5033">
<em data-start="5036" data-end="5131">A dedicated infrastructure layer for service-to-service communication (e.g., Istio, Linkerd).</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5133" data-end="5136" class="">
<h3 data-start="5138" data-end="5166" class=""><strong data-start="5142" data-end="5166">Real-World Scenarios</strong></h3>
<ol start="36" data-start="5168" data-end="5716">
<li data-start="5168" data-end="5264" class="">
<p data-start="5172" data-end="5264" class=""><strong data-start="5172" data-end="5212">What happens if one service is down?</strong><br data-start="5212" data-end="5215">
<em data-start="5218" data-end="5264">Use circuit breaker and fallback strategies.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5266" data-end="5392" class="">
<p data-start="5270" data-end="5392" class=""><strong data-start="5270" data-end="5320">How do you implement retries in microservices?</strong><br data-start="5320" data-end="5323">
<em data-start="5326" data-end="5392">Using Resilience4j retry module or exponential backoff strategy.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5394" data-end="5494" class="">
<p data-start="5398" data-end="5494" class=""><strong data-start="5398" data-end="5433">How do you scale microservices?</strong><br data-start="5433" data-end="5436">
<em data-start="5439" data-end="5494">Horizontally scale individual services based on load.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5496" data-end="5607" class="">
<p data-start="5500" data-end="5607" class=""><strong data-start="5500" data-end="5534">How do you test microservices?</strong><br data-start="5534" data-end="5537">
<em data-start="5540" data-end="5607">Unit testing, integration testing, contract testing (e.g., Pact).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5609" data-end="5716" class="">
<p data-start="5613" data-end="5716" class=""><strong data-start="5613" data-end="5666">How do you ensure backward compatibility in APIs?</strong><br data-start="5666" data-end="5669">
<em data-start="5672" data-end="5716">Use versioning and avoid breaking changes.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5718" data-end="5721" class="">
<h3 data-start="5723" data-end="5755" class=""><strong data-start="5727" data-end="5755">Patterns &amp; Anti-Patterns</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="5757" data-end="6351">
<li data-start="5757" data-end="5866" class="">
<p data-start="5761" data-end="5866" class=""><strong data-start="5761" data-end="5806">What is the database-per-service pattern?</strong><br data-start="5806" data-end="5809">
<em data-start="5812" data-end="5866">Each microservice owns and manages its own database.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5868" data-end="5992" class="">
<p data-start="5872" data-end="5992" class=""><strong data-start="5872" data-end="5917">What is the shared database anti-pattern?</strong><br data-start="5917" data-end="5920">
<em data-start="5923" data-end="5992">Multiple services accessing the same DB, leading to tight coupling.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5994" data-end="6122" class="">
<p data-start="5998" data-end="6122" class=""><strong data-start="5998" data-end="6030">What is the sidecar pattern?</strong><br data-start="6030" data-end="6033">
<em data-start="6036" data-end="6122">Deploying auxiliary services (e.g., logging, monitoring) alongside the main service.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6124" data-end="6229" class="">
<p data-start="6128" data-end="6229" class=""><strong data-start="6128" data-end="6162">What is the strangler pattern?</strong><br data-start="6162" data-end="6165">
<em data-start="6168" data-end="6229">Gradually replacing parts of a monolith with microservices.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6231" data-end="6351" class="">
<p data-start="6235" data-end="6351" class=""><strong data-start="6235" data-end="6268">What is the bulkhead pattern?</strong><br data-start="6268" data-end="6271">
<em data-start="6274" data-end="6351">Isolating services/components so that failure in one doesn’t affect others.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="6353" data-end="6356" class="">
<h3 data-start="6358" data-end="6382" class=""><strong data-start="6362" data-end="6382">DevOps and Tools</strong></h3>
<ol start="46" data-start="6384" data-end="7010">
<li data-start="6384" data-end="6509" class="">
<p data-start="6388" data-end="6509" class=""><strong data-start="6388" data-end="6446">Which tools are commonly used for microservices CI/CD?</strong><br data-start="6446" data-end="6449">
<em data-start="6452" data-end="6509">Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, Argo CD, Spinnaker.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6511" data-end="6618" class="">
<p data-start="6515" data-end="6618" class=""><strong data-start="6515" data-end="6574">What are some common container orchestration platforms?</strong><br data-start="6574" data-end="6577">
<em data-start="6580" data-end="6618">Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, OpenShift.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6620" data-end="6726" class="">
<p data-start="6624" data-end="6726" class=""><strong data-start="6624" data-end="6667">How do you containerize a microservice?</strong><br data-start="6667" data-end="6670">
<em data-start="6673" data-end="6726">Using Docker to build images and define containers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6728" data-end="6856" class="">
<p data-start="6732" data-end="6856" class=""><strong data-start="6732" data-end="6785">How do you ensure observability in microservices?</strong><br data-start="6785" data-end="6788">
<em data-start="6791" data-end="6856">Use logs (ELK), metrics (Prometheus), tracing (Zipkin, Jaeger).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6858" data-end="7010" class="">
<p data-start="6862" data-end="7010" class=""><strong data-start="6862" data-end="6916">How do you migrate from monolith to microservices?</strong><br data-start="6916" data-end="6919">
<em data-start="6922" data-end="7010">Use strangler fig pattern, start with less risky modules, isolate services one-by-one.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="7012" data-end="7015" class="">
<p data-start="7017" data-end="7177" class="">Let me know if you’d like to dive deeper into any of these — like Spring Cloud implementation, Eureka, Gateway, JWT security, Docker/Kubernetes Here are <strong data-start="18" data-end="64">50 Docker interview questions with answers</strong>, from beginner to advanced level, including practical insights for DevOps and microservices:</p>
<hr data-start="159" data-end="162" class="">
<h3 data-start="164" data-end="188" class=""><strong data-start="168" data-end="188">Basics of Docker</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="190" data-end="908">
<li data-start="190" data-end="347" class="">
<p data-start="193" data-end="347" class=""><strong data-start="193" data-end="212">What is Docker?</strong><br data-start="212" data-end="215">
<em data-start="218" data-end="347">Docker is a containerization platform that allows you to package applications with their dependencies into portable containers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="349" data-end="522" class="">
<p data-start="352" data-end="522" class=""><strong data-start="352" data-end="376">What is a container?</strong><br data-start="376" data-end="379">
<em data-start="382" data-end="522">A container is a lightweight, standalone executable that includes everything needed to run a piece of software (code, runtime, libraries).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="524" data-end="712" class="">
<p data-start="527" data-end="712" class=""><strong data-start="527" data-end="596">What is the difference between a container and a virtual machine?</strong><br data-start="596" data-end="599">
<em data-start="602" data-end="712">Containers share the host OS kernel, while VMs run a full OS, making containers faster and more lightweight.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="714" data-end="804" class="">
<p data-start="717" data-end="804" class=""><strong data-start="717" data-end="740">What is Docker Hub?</strong><br data-start="740" data-end="743">
<em data-start="746" data-end="804">A cloud-based registry to store and share Docker images.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="806" data-end="908" class="">
<p data-start="809" data-end="908" class=""><strong data-start="809" data-end="836">What is a Docker image?</strong><br data-start="836" data-end="839">
<em data-start="842" data-end="908">A read-only template with instructions for creating a container.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="13" data-start="1696" data-end="2091">
<li data-start="1696" data-end="1830" class="">
<p data-start="1700" data-end="1830" class=""><strong data-start="1700" data-end="1750">What is the purpose of <code data-start="1725" data-end="1737">ENTRYPOINT</code> and <code data-start="1742" data-end="1747">CMD</code>?</strong><br data-start="1750" data-end="1753">
<em data-start="1756" data-end="1830"><code data-start="1757" data-end="1769">ENTRYPOINT</code> defines the main command. <code data-start="1796" data-end="1801">CMD</code> provides default arguments.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1832" data-end="1967" class="">
<p data-start="1836" data-end="1967" class=""><strong data-start="1836" data-end="1883">What does <code data-start="1848" data-end="1854">COPY</code> vs <code data-start="1858" data-end="1863">ADD</code> do in Dockerfile?</strong><br data-start="1883" data-end="1886">
<em data-start="1889" data-end="1967">Both copy files, but <code data-start="1911" data-end="1916">ADD</code> supports remote URLs and extracting tar archives.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1969" data-end="2091" class="">
<p data-start="1973" data-end="2091" class=""><strong data-start="1973" data-end="2005">What is a multi-stage build?</strong><br data-start="2005" data-end="2008">
<em data-start="2011" data-end="2091">A Dockerfile that uses multiple <code data-start="2044" data-end="2050">FROM</code> statements to optimize the final image.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="23" data-start="2940" data-end="3259">
<li data-start="2940" data-end="3069" class="">
<p data-start="2944" data-end="3069" class=""><strong data-start="2944" data-end="3003">What is the difference between bind mounts and volumes?</strong><br data-start="3003" data-end="3006">
<em data-start="3009" data-end="3069">Bind mounts map host paths; volumes are managed by Docker.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3071" data-end="3179" class="">
<p data-start="3075" data-end="3179" class=""><strong data-start="3075" data-end="3111">How does Docker networking work?</strong><br data-start="3111" data-end="3114">
<em data-start="3117" data-end="3179">Docker creates virtual networks for container communication.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3181" data-end="3259" class="">
<p data-start="3185" data-end="3259" class=""><strong data-start="3185" data-end="3214">Types of Docker networks?</strong><br data-start="3214" data-end="3217">
<em data-start="3220" data-end="3259">Bridge, Host, None, Overlay, Macvlan.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>

<li data-start="3745" data-end="3862" class="">
<p data-start="3749" data-end="3862" class=""><strong data-start="3749" data-end="3787">How to update a running container?</strong><br data-start="3787" data-end="3790">

</li>

<hr data-start="4448" data-end="4451" class="">
<h3 data-start="4453" data-end="4486" class=""><strong data-start="4457" data-end="4486">Security &amp; Best Practices</strong></h3>
<ol start="36" data-start="4488" data-end="5117">
<li data-start="4488" data-end="4622" class="">
<p data-start="4492" data-end="4622" class=""><strong data-start="4492" data-end="4533">How do you secure a Docker container?</strong><br data-start="4533" data-end="4536">
<em data-start="4539" data-end="4622">Run as non-root, use minimal base images, scan images, and apply least privilege.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4624" data-end="4742" class="">
<p data-start="4628" data-end="4742" class=""><strong data-start="4628" data-end="4666">What is Docker Bench for Security?</strong><br data-start="4666" data-end="4669">
<em data-start="4672" data-end="4742">A script that checks for common best practices in Docker deployment.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4744" data-end="4865" class="">
<p data-start="4748" data-end="4865" class=""><strong data-start="4748" data-end="4777">How to reduce image size?</strong><br data-start="4777" data-end="4780">
<em data-start="4783" data-end="4865">Use multi-stage builds, minimal base images like <code data-start="4833" data-end="4841">alpine</code>, and clear temp files.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4867" data-end="5002" class="">
<p data-start="4871" data-end="5002" class=""><strong data-start="4871" data-end="4917">What are some Docker image best practices?</strong><br data-start="4917" data-end="4920">
<em data-start="4923" data-end="5002">Pin image versions, avoid using <code data-start="4956" data-end="4964">latest</code>, reduce layers, use <code data-start="4985" data-end="5000">.dockerignore</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5004" data-end="5117" class="">
<p data-start="5008" data-end="5117" class=""><strong data-start="5008" data-end="5036">What is <code data-start="5018" data-end="5033">.dockerignore</code>?</strong><br data-start="5036" data-end="5039">
<em data-start="5042" data-end="5117">Specifies files/folders to ignore while building the image (like <code data-start="5108" data-end="5114">.git</code>).</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5119" data-end="5122" class="">
<h3 data-start="5124" data-end="5153" class=""><strong data-start="5128" data-end="5153">Advanced / Real-World</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="5155" data-end="5725">
<li data-start="5155" data-end="5257" class="">
<p data-start="5159" data-end="5257" class=""><strong data-start="5159" data-end="5197">How do you debug container issues?</strong><br data-start="5197" data-end="5200">
<em data-start="5203" data-end="5257">Use <code data-start="5208" data-end="5221">docker logs</code>, <code data-start="5223" data-end="5236">docker exec</code>, and health checks.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5259" data-end="5361" class="">
<p data-start="5263" data-end="5361" class=""><strong data-start="5263" data-end="5300">What are health checks in Docker?</strong><br data-start="5300" data-end="5303">
<em data-start="5306" data-end="5361">Commands in Dockerfile to test if the app is healthy.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5363" data-end="5496" class="">
<p data-start="5367" data-end="5496" class=""><strong data-start="5367" data-end="5422">What is the difference between <code data-start="5400" data-end="5406">COPY</code> and <code data-start="5411" data-end="5419">VOLUME</code>?</strong><br data-start="5422" data-end="5425">
<em data-start="5428" data-end="5496"><code data-start="5429" data-end="5435">COPY</code> adds files to the image; <code data-start="5461" data-end="5469">VOLUME</code> mounts a persistent path.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5498" data-end="5592" class="">
<p data-start="5502" data-end="5592" class=""><strong data-start="5502" data-end="5527">What is Docker Swarm?</strong><br data-start="5527" data-end="5530">
<em data-start="5533" data-end="5592">Docker’s native orchestration tool for managing clusters.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5594" data-end="5725" class="">
<p data-start="5598" data-end="5725" class=""><strong data-start="5598" data-end="5643">What is the role of Kubernetes vs Docker?</strong><br data-start="5643" data-end="5646">
<em data-start="5649" data-end="5725">Docker runs containers; Kubernetes orchestrates and manages them at scale.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5727" data-end="5730" class="">
<h3 data-start="5732" data-end="5767" class=""><strong data-start="5736" data-end="5767">Integration &amp; Microservices</strong></h3>
<ol start="46" data-start="5769" data-end="6395">
<li data-start="5769" data-end="5908" class="">
<p data-start="5773" data-end="5908" class=""><strong data-start="5773" data-end="5813">How is Docker used in microservices?</strong><br data-start="5813" data-end="5816">
<em data-start="5819" data-end="5908">Each service is packaged into its own container for independent scaling and deployment.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5910" data-end="6058" class="">
<p data-start="5914" data-end="6058" class=""><strong data-start="5914" data-end="5965">How to connect microservices in Docker Compose?</strong><br data-start="5965" data-end="5968">
<em data-start="5971" data-end="6058">Define them in the same <code data-start="5996" data-end="6016">docker-compose.yml</code> and use service names for communication.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6060" data-end="6169" class="">
<p data-start="6064" data-end="6169" class=""><strong data-start="6064" data-end="6111">How to manage environment-specific configs?</strong><br data-start="6111" data-end="6114">
<em data-start="6117" data-end="6169">Use <code data-start="6122" data-end="6128">.env</code> files or <code data-start="6138" data-end="6167">docker-compose.override.yml</code>.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6171" data-end="6288" class="">
<p data-start="6175" data-end="6288" class=""><strong data-start="6175" data-end="6218">How do you implement logging in Docker?</strong><br data-start="6218" data-end="6221">
<em data-start="6224" data-end="6288">Use logging drivers (e.g., <code data-start="6252" data-end="6263">json-file</code>, <code data-start="6265" data-end="6274">fluentd</code>, <code data-start="6276" data-end="6285">awslogs</code>).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="6290" data-end="6395" class="">
<p data-start="6294" data-end="6395" class=""><strong data-start="6294" data-end="6342">What is the lifecycle of a Docker container?</strong><br data-start="6342" data-end="6345">
<em data-start="6348" data-end="6395">Created → Running → Paused/Stopped → Removed.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>

Here's a comprehensive list of <strong data-start="38" data-end="88">50 Kubernetes interview questions with answers</strong>, categorized by beginner, intermediate, and advanced levels:</p>
<hr data-start="151" data-end="154" class="">
<h3 data-start="156" data-end="178" class=""><strong data-start="160" data-end="178">Beginner Level</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="180" data-end="1401">
<li data-start="180" data-end="343" class="">
<p data-start="183" data-end="343" class=""><strong data-start="183" data-end="206">What is Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="206" data-end="209">
<em data-start="212" data-end="343">An open-source container orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="345" data-end="540" class="">
<p data-start="348" data-end="540" class=""><strong data-start="348" data-end="408">What are the main components of Kubernetes architecture?</strong><br data-start="408" data-end="411">
<em data-start="414" data-end="540">Master (Control Plane), Nodes (Workers), etcd, kube-apiserver, kube-scheduler, kube-controller-manager, kubelet, kube-proxy.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="542" data-end="653" class="">
<p data-start="545" data-end="653" class=""><strong data-start="545" data-end="563">What is a Pod?</strong><br data-start="563" data-end="566">
<em data-start="569" data-end="653">The smallest deployable unit in Kubernetes, which can hold one or more containers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="655" data-end="739" class="">
<p data-start="658" data-end="739" class=""><strong data-start="658" data-end="677">What is a Node?</strong><br data-start="677" data-end="680">
<em data-start="683" data-end="739">A machine (VM or physical) where Kubernetes runs Pods.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="741" data-end="865" class="">
<p data-start="744" data-end="865" class=""><strong data-start="744" data-end="774">What is the Control Plane?</strong><br data-start="774" data-end="777">
<em data-start="780" data-end="865">It manages the cluster, making decisions about scheduling and responding to events.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="867" data-end="960" class="">
<p data-start="870" data-end="960" class=""><strong data-start="870" data-end="892">What is <code data-start="880" data-end="889">kubectl</code>?</strong><br data-start="892" data-end="895">
<em data-start="898" data-end="960">The command-line tool to interact with a Kubernetes cluster.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="962" data-end="1064" class="">
<p data-start="965" data-end="1011" class=""><strong data-start="965" data-end="1009">How do you list all Pods in a namespace?</strong></p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1015" data-end="1064"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none </li>
<li data-start="1066" data-end="1141" class="">

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
</li>
<li data-start="1143" data-end="1239" class="">
<p data-start="1146" data-end="1239" class=""><strong data-start="1146" data-end="1163">What is etcd?</strong><br data-start="1163" data-end="1166">
<em data-start="1169" data-end="1239">A distributed key-value store used to store Kubernetes cluster data.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1241" data-end="1401" class="">
<p data-start="1245" data-end="1401" class=""><strong data-start="1245" data-end="1308">What is the difference between a ReplicaSet and Deployment?</strong><br data-start="1308" data-end="1311">
<em data-start="1314" data-end="1401">ReplicaSet ensures desired pod count. Deployment adds rolling updates and versioning.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1403" data-end="1406" class="">
<h3 data-start="1408" data-end="1434" class=""><strong data-start="1412" data-end="1434">Intermediate Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="11" data-start="1436" data-end="1799">
<li data-start="1436" data-end="1554" class="">
<p data-start="1440" data-end="1554" class=""><strong data-start="1440" data-end="1476">What is a Service in Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="1476" data-end="1479">
<em data-start="1482" data-end="1554">An abstraction that exposes a set of Pods via a stable IP or DNS name.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1556" data-end="1649" class="">
<p data-start="1560" data-end="1649" class=""><strong data-start="1560" data-end="1593">Types of Kubernetes Services?</strong><br data-start="1593" data-end="1596">
<em data-start="1599" data-end="1649">ClusterIP, NodePort, LoadBalancer, ExternalName.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1651" data-end="1753" class="">
<p data-start="1655" data-end="1753" class=""><strong data-start="1655" data-end="1679">What is a Namespace?</strong><br data-start="1679" data-end="1682">
<em data-start="1685" data-end="1753">A way to divide cluster resources between multiple users/projects.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1755" data-end="1799" class="">
<p data-start="1759" data-end="1799" class=""><strong data-start="1759" data-end="1797">How to scale Pods in a Deployment?</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="15" data-start="1870" data-end="2326">
<li data-start="1870" data-end="1950" class="">
<p data-start="1874" data-end="1950" class=""><strong data-start="1874" data-end="1898">What is a ConfigMap?</strong><br data-start="1898" data-end="1901">
<em data-start="1904" data-end="1950">Used to inject configuration data into Pods.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1952" data-end="2039" class="">
<p data-start="1956" data-end="2039" class=""><strong data-start="1956" data-end="1977">What is a Secret?</strong><br data-start="1977" data-end="1980">
<em data-start="1983" data-end="2039">Stores sensitive data like passwords, tokens, or keys.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2041" data-end="2150" class="">
<p data-start="2045" data-end="2150" class=""><strong data-start="2045" data-end="2080">What is a Volume in Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="2080" data-end="2083">
<em data-start="2086" data-end="2150">Provides persistent or shared storage for containers in a Pod.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2152" data-end="2274" class="">
<p data-start="2156" data-end="2274" class=""><strong data-start="2156" data-end="2200">Difference between ConfigMap and Secret?</strong><br data-start="2200" data-end="2203">
<em data-start="2206" data-end="2274">Secrets are base64 encoded and intended for sensitive information.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2276" data-end="2326" class="">
<p data-start="2280" data-end="2326" class=""><strong data-start="2280" data-end="2324">How to expose a deployment as a service?</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="20" data-start="2412" data-end="2513">
<li data-start="2412" data-end="2513" class="">
<p data-start="2416" data-end="2513" class=""><strong data-start="2416" data-end="2439">What is an Ingress?</strong><br data-start="2439" data-end="2442">
<em data-start="2445" data-end="2513">Manages external access to services, typically HTTP/HTTPS routing.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2515" data-end="2518" class="">
<h3 data-start="2520" data-end="2548" class=""><strong data-start="2524" data-end="2548">Pods and Controllers</strong></h3>
<ol start="21" data-start="2550" data-end="3014">
<li data-start="2550" data-end="2635" class="">
<p data-start="2554" data-end="2635" class=""><strong data-start="2554" data-end="2578">What is a DaemonSet?</strong><br data-start="2578" data-end="2581">
<em data-start="2584" data-end="2635">Ensures that a Pod runs on all or selected Nodes.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2637" data-end="2752" class="">
<p data-start="2641" data-end="2752" class=""><strong data-start="2641" data-end="2667">What is a StatefulSet?</strong><br data-start="2667" data-end="2670">
<em data-start="2673" data-end="2752">Used for applications that require persistent storage and ordered deployment.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2754" data-end="2827" class="">
<p data-start="2758" data-end="2827" class=""><strong data-start="2758" data-end="2776">What is a Job?</strong><br data-start="2776" data-end="2779">
<em data-start="2782" data-end="2827">Used to create Pods that run to completion.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2829" data-end="2913" class="">
<p data-start="2833" data-end="2913" class=""><strong data-start="2833" data-end="2855">What is a CronJob?</strong><br data-start="2855" data-end="2858">
<em data-start="2861" data-end="2913">Schedules Jobs to run periodically at fixed times.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2915" data-end="3014" class="">
<p data-start="2919" data-end="3014" class=""><strong data-start="2919" data-end="2962">How does Kubernetes do rolling updates?</strong><br data-start="2962" data-end="2965">
<em data-start="2968" data-end="3014">Through Deployments using update strategies.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3016" data-end="3019" class="">
<h3 data-start="3021" data-end="3043" class=""><strong data-start="3025" data-end="3043">Advanced Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="26" data-start="3045" data-end="4205">
<li data-start="3045" data-end="3156" class="">
<p data-start="3049" data-end="3156" class=""><strong data-start="3049" data-end="3081">What is the role of kubelet?</strong><br data-start="3081" data-end="3084">
<em data-start="3087" data-end="3156">An agent that runs on each node and ensures containers are running.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3158" data-end="3239" class="">
<p data-start="3162" data-end="3239" class=""><strong data-start="3162" data-end="3185">What is kube-proxy?</strong><br data-start="3185" data-end="3188">
<em data-start="3191" data-end="3239">Maintains network rules for Pod communication.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3241" data-end="3347" class="">
<p data-start="3245" data-end="3347" class=""><strong data-start="3245" data-end="3280">What is a Taint and Toleration?</strong><br data-start="3280" data-end="3283">
<em data-start="3286" data-end="3347">Used to control which pods can be scheduled on which nodes.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3349" data-end="3463" class="">
<p data-start="3353" data-end="3463" class=""><strong data-start="3353" data-end="3382">What is an Affinity rule?</strong><br data-start="3382" data-end="3385">
<em data-start="3388" data-end="3463">Controls pod scheduling based on rules (node/pod affinity/anti-affinity).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3465" data-end="3580" class="">
<p data-start="3469" data-end="3580" class=""><strong data-start="3469" data-end="3494">What is a Helm chart?</strong><br data-start="3494" data-end="3497">
<em data-start="3500" data-end="3580">A package manager for Kubernetes that helps define, install, and upgrade apps.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3582" data-end="3697" class="">
<p data-start="3586" data-end="3697" class=""><strong data-start="3586" data-end="3618">What is a sidecar container?</strong><br data-start="3618" data-end="3621">
<em data-start="3624" data-end="3697">A helper container that runs alongside the main app container in a Pod.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3699" data-end="3840" class="">
<p data-start="3703" data-end="3840" class=""><strong data-start="3703" data-end="3730">What is a Service Mesh?</strong><br data-start="3730" data-end="3733">
<em data-start="3736" data-end="3840">A dedicated infrastructure layer for managing service-to-service communication (e.g., Istio, Linkerd).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3842" data-end="3955" class="">
<p data-start="3846" data-end="3955" class=""><strong data-start="3846" data-end="3885">How do you manage secrets securely?</strong><br data-start="3885" data-end="3888">
<em data-start="3891" data-end="3955">Use Kubernetes Secrets, integrate with Vault, and enable RBAC.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3957" data-end="4069" class="">
<p data-start="3961" data-end="4069" class=""><strong data-start="3961" data-end="4007">How to perform a zero-downtime deployment?</strong><br data-start="4007" data-end="4010">
<em data-start="4013" data-end="4069">Using rolling updates, readiness probes, and replicas.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4071" data-end="4205" class="">
<p data-start="4075" data-end="4205" class=""><strong data-start="4075" data-end="4113">What is Horizontal Pod Autoscaler?</strong><br data-start="4113" data-end="4116">
<em data-start="4119" data-end="4205">Automatically scales the number of Pods based on CPU/memory usage or custom metrics.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4207" data-end="4210" class="">
<h3 data-start="4212" data-end="4250" class=""><strong data-start="4216" data-end="4250">Monitoring, Logging &amp; Security</strong></h3>
<ol start="36" data-start="4252" data-end="4827">
<li data-start="4252" data-end="4354" class="">
<p data-start="4256" data-end="4354" class=""><strong data-start="4256" data-end="4290">How do you monitor Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="4290" data-end="4293">
<em data-start="4296" data-end="4354">With tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Kube-state-metrics.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4356" data-end="4475" class="">
<p data-start="4360" data-end="4475" class=""><strong data-start="4360" data-end="4404">How do you enable logging in Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="4404" data-end="4407">
<em data-start="4410" data-end="4475">Use centralized logging tools like Fluentd, ELK stack, or Loki.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4477" data-end="4621" class="">
<p data-start="4481" data-end="4621" class=""><strong data-start="4481" data-end="4524">What are Readiness and Liveness Probes?</strong><br data-start="4524" data-end="4527">
<em data-start="4530" data-end="4621">Readiness: when a pod is ready to receive traffic. Liveness: if the app is still running.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4623" data-end="4732" class="">
<p data-start="4627" data-end="4732" class=""><strong data-start="4627" data-end="4658">What is RBAC in Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="4658" data-end="4661">
<em data-start="4664" data-end="4732">Role-Based Access Control - manages who can access what resources.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4734" data-end="4827" class="">
<p data-start="4738" data-end="4827" class=""><strong data-start="4738" data-end="4766">What is a NetworkPolicy?</strong><br data-start="4766" data-end="4769">
<em data-start="4772" data-end="4827">Defines rules for network communication between Pods.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4829" data-end="4832" class="">
<h3 data-start="4834" data-end="4867" class=""><strong data-start="4838" data-end="4867">CI/CD, Tools &amp; Real-World</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="4869" data-end="5612">
<li data-start="4869" data-end="5018" class="">
<p data-start="4873" data-end="5018" class=""><strong data-start="4873" data-end="4916">How do you deploy an app to Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="4916" data-end="4919">
<em data-start="4922" data-end="5018">Build Docker image → push to registry → create Deployment + Service YAML → apply with kubectl.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5020" data-end="5129" class="">
<p data-start="5024" data-end="5129" class=""><strong data-start="5024" data-end="5071">What are common tools used with Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="5071" data-end="5074">
<em data-start="5077" data-end="5129">Helm, Argo CD, Flux, Prometheus, Istio, Kustomize.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5131" data-end="5240" class="">
<p data-start="5135" data-end="5240" class=""><strong data-start="5135" data-end="5157">What is Kustomize?</strong><br data-start="5157" data-end="5160">
<em data-start="5163" data-end="5240">A configuration management tool built into kubectl to customize YAML files.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5242" data-end="5315" class="">
<p data-start="5246" data-end="5315" class=""><strong data-start="5246" data-end="5266">What is kubeadm?</strong><br data-start="5266" data-end="5269">
<em data-start="5272" data-end="5315">A tool to bootstrap a Kubernetes cluster.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5317" data-end="5417" class="">
<p data-start="5321" data-end="5417" class=""><strong data-start="5321" data-end="5342">What is Minikube?</strong><br data-start="5342" data-end="5345">
<em data-start="5348" data-end="5417">Runs a single-node Kubernetes cluster locally for learning/testing.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5419" data-end="5567" class="">
<p data-start="5423" data-end="5567" class=""><strong data-start="5423" data-end="5473">Difference between Deployment and StatefulSet?</strong><br data-start="5473" data-end="5476">
<em data-start="5479" data-end="5567">Deployment: stateless apps. StatefulSet: apps needing persistent identity and storage.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5569" data-end="5612" class="">
<p data-start="5573" data-end="5612" class=""><strong data-start="5573" data-end="5610">How to troubleshoot a failed Pod?</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="48" data-start="5686" data-end="6056">
<li data-start="5686" data-end="5819" class="">
<p data-start="5690" data-end="5819" class=""><strong data-start="5690" data-end="5746">What is the role of Container Runtime in Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="5746" data-end="5749">
<em data-start="5752" data-end="5819">Software (like containerd, CRI-O) that runs containers on a node.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5821" data-end="5948" class="">
<p data-start="5825" data-end="5948" class=""><strong data-start="5825" data-end="5861">What is a cluster in Kubernetes?</strong><br data-start="5861" data-end="5864">
<em data-start="5867" data-end="5948">A set of nodes (machines) managed by Kubernetes to run containerized workloads.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5950" data-end="6056" class="">
<p data-start="5954" data-end="6056" class=""><strong data-start="5954" data-end="6003">How does Kubernetes handle service discovery?</strong><br data-start="6003" data-end="6006">
<em data-start="6009" data-end="6056">Using internal DNS and environment variables.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>

break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="167" class="">Awesome! Here are <strong data-start="18" data-end="61">50 AWS interview questions with answers</strong>, covering beginner to advanced levels and tailored for real-world usage, DevOps, and backend development:</p>
<hr data-start="169" data-end="172" class="">
<h3 data-start="174" data-end="193" class=""><strong data-start="178" data-end="193">Basic Level</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="195" data-end="1302">
<li data-start="195" data-end="317" class="">
<p data-start="198" data-end="317" class=""><strong data-start="198" data-end="214">What is AWS?</strong><br data-start="214" data-end="217">
<em data-start="220" data-end="317">Amazon Web Services is a cloud platform that offers on-demand computing resources and services.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="319" data-end="408" class="">
<p data-start="322" data-end="408" class=""><strong data-start="322" data-end="338">What is EC2?</strong><br data-start="338" data-end="341">
<em data-start="344" data-end="408">Elastic Compute Cloud – it provides resizable virtual servers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="410" data-end="528" class="">
<p data-start="413" data-end="528" class=""><strong data-start="413" data-end="428">What is S3?</strong><br data-start="428" data-end="431">
<em data-start="434" data-end="528">Simple Storage Service – object storage with high availability, durability, and scalability.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="530" data-end="640" class="">
<p data-start="533" data-end="640" class=""><strong data-start="533" data-end="549">What is IAM?</strong><br data-start="549" data-end="552">
<em data-start="555" data-end="640">Identity and Access Management – it controls users, groups, roles, and permissions.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="642" data-end="749" class="">
<p data-start="645" data-end="749" class=""><strong data-start="645" data-end="674">What are Security Groups?</strong><br data-start="674" data-end="677">
<em data-start="680" data-end="749">Virtual firewalls controlling inbound and outbound traffic for EC2.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="751" data-end="845" class="">
<p data-start="754" data-end="845" class=""><strong data-start="754" data-end="770">What is EBS?</strong><br data-start="770" data-end="773">
<em data-start="776" data-end="845">Elastic Block Store – provides block-level storage volumes for EC2.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="847" data-end="965" class="">
<p data-start="850" data-end="965" class=""><strong data-start="850" data-end="896">What is the difference between S3 and EBS?</strong><br data-start="896" data-end="899">
<em data-start="902" data-end="965">S3 is object storage; EBS is block storage for EC2 instances.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="967" data-end="1059" class="">
<p data-start="970" data-end="1059" class=""><strong data-start="970" data-end="989">What is an AMI?</strong><br data-start="989" data-end="992">
<em data-start="995" data-end="1059">Amazon Machine Image – a template for launching EC2 instances.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1061" data-end="1180" class="">
<p data-start="1064" data-end="1180" class=""><strong data-start="1064" data-end="1107">What is the default region for AWS CLI?</strong><br data-start="1107" data-end="1110">
<em data-start="1113" data-end="1180">It depends on your config, usually <code data-start="1149" data-end="1160">us-east-1</code> unless overridden.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1182" data-end="1302" class="">
<p data-start="1186" data-end="1302" class=""><strong data-start="1186" data-end="1216">What is the AWS Free Tier?</strong><br data-start="1216" data-end="1219">
<em data-start="1222" data-end="1302">A usage limit that provides free services for new AWS customers for 12 months.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="1304" data-end="1307" class="">
<h3 data-start="1309" data-end="1335" class=""><strong data-start="1313" data-end="1335">Intermediate Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="11" data-start="1337" data-end="2464">
<li data-start="1337" data-end="1453" class="">
<p data-start="1341" data-end="1453" class=""><strong data-start="1341" data-end="1381">What is an Auto Scaling Group (ASG)?</strong><br data-start="1381" data-end="1384">
<em data-start="1387" data-end="1453">Automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances based on load.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1455" data-end="1578" class="">
<p data-start="1459" data-end="1578" class=""><strong data-start="1459" data-end="1502">What is an Elastic Load Balancer (ELB)?</strong><br data-start="1502" data-end="1505">
<em data-start="1508" data-end="1578">Distributes traffic across multiple targets (e.g., EC2, containers).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1580" data-end="1713" class="">
<p data-start="1584" data-end="1713" class=""><strong data-start="1584" data-end="1645">Difference between Application and Network Load Balancer?</strong><br data-start="1645" data-end="1648">
<em data-start="1651" data-end="1713">ALB works at Layer 7 (HTTP/HTTPS); NLB at Layer 4 (TCP/UDP).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1715" data-end="1788" class="">
<p data-start="1719" data-end="1788" class=""><strong data-start="1719" data-end="1740">What is Route 53?</strong><br data-start="1740" data-end="1743">
<em data-start="1746" data-end="1788">AWS’s DNS and domain management service.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1790" data-end="1871" class="">
<p data-start="1794" data-end="1871" class=""><strong data-start="1794" data-end="1810">What is VPC?</strong><br data-start="1810" data-end="1813">
<em data-start="1816" data-end="1871">Virtual Private Cloud – your isolated network in AWS.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="1873" data-end="2024" class="">
<p data-start="1877" data-end="2024" class=""><strong data-start="1877" data-end="1939">What is the difference between public and private subnets?</strong><br data-start="1939" data-end="1942">
<em data-start="1945" data-end="2024">Public has a route to the internet via an internet gateway; private does not.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2026" data-end="2123" class="">
<p data-start="2030" data-end="2123" class=""><strong data-start="2030" data-end="2056">What is a NAT Gateway?</strong><br data-start="2056" data-end="2059">
<em data-start="2062" data-end="2123">Allows instances in private subnets to access the internet.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2125" data-end="2215" class="">
<p data-start="2129" data-end="2215" class=""><strong data-start="2129" data-end="2152">What is CloudWatch?</strong><br data-start="2152" data-end="2155">
<em data-start="2158" data-end="2215">Monitoring and observability service for AWS resources.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2217" data-end="2314" class="">
<p data-start="2221" data-end="2314" class=""><strong data-start="2221" data-end="2244">What is CloudTrail?</strong><br data-start="2244" data-end="2247">
<em data-start="2250" data-end="2314">Tracks API calls and logs user activity for security/auditing.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2316" data-end="2464" class="">
<p data-start="2320" data-end="2464" class=""><strong data-start="2320" data-end="2381">What is the difference between CloudWatch and CloudTrail?</strong><br data-start="2381" data-end="2384">
<em data-start="2387" data-end="2464">CloudWatch: performance monitoring. CloudTrail: auditing/logging API calls.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2466" data-end="2469" class="">
<h3 data-start="2471" data-end="2497" class=""><strong data-start="2475" data-end="2497">Storage &amp; Database</strong></h3>
<ol start="21" data-start="2499" data-end="2958">
<li data-start="2499" data-end="2609" class="">
<p data-start="2503" data-end="2609" class=""><strong data-start="2503" data-end="2526">What is Amazon RDS?</strong><br data-start="2526" data-end="2529">
<em data-start="2532" data-end="2609">Relational Database Service – managed SQL databases (MySQL, Postgres, etc).</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2611" data-end="2683" class="">
<p data-start="2615" data-end="2683" class=""><strong data-start="2615" data-end="2636">What is DynamoDB?</strong><br data-start="2636" data-end="2639">
<em data-start="2642" data-end="2683">A fully managed NoSQL database service.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2685" data-end="2790" class="">
<p data-start="2689" data-end="2790" class=""><strong data-start="2689" data-end="2729">Difference between RDS and DynamoDB?</strong><br data-start="2729" data-end="2732">
<em data-start="2735" data-end="2790">RDS is relational (SQL); DynamoDB is key-value NoSQL.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2792" data-end="2879" class="">
<p data-start="2796" data-end="2879" class=""><strong data-start="2796" data-end="2822">What is S3 versioning?</strong><br data-start="2822" data-end="2825">
<em data-start="2828" data-end="2879">Keeps multiple versions of an object in a bucket.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="2881" data-end="2958" class="">
<p data-start="2885" data-end="2958" class=""><strong data-start="2885" data-end="2905">What is Glacier?</strong><br data-start="2905" data-end="2908">
<em data-start="2911" data-end="2958">Long-term archival storage in S3 at low cost.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2960" data-end="2963" class="">
<h3 data-start="2965" data-end="2987" class=""><strong data-start="2969" data-end="2987">DevOps &amp; CI/CD</strong></h3>
<ol start="26" data-start="2989" data-end="3479">
<li data-start="2989" data-end="3088" class="">
<p data-start="2993" data-end="3088" class=""><strong data-start="2993" data-end="3018">What is CodePipeline?</strong><br data-start="3018" data-end="3021">
<em data-start="3024" data-end="3088">Orchestrates CI/CD pipelines for deploying code automatically.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3090" data-end="3182" class="">
<p data-start="3094" data-end="3182" class=""><strong data-start="3094" data-end="3117">What is CodeDeploy?</strong><br data-start="3117" data-end="3120">
<em data-start="3123" data-end="3182">Automates deployments to EC2, Lambda, or on-prem servers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3184" data-end="3271" class="">
<p data-start="3188" data-end="3271" class=""><strong data-start="3188" data-end="3210">What is CodeBuild?</strong><br data-start="3210" data-end="3213">
<em data-start="3216" data-end="3271">Builds and tests your code in a scalable environment.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3273" data-end="3375" class="">
<p data-start="3277" data-end="3375" class=""><strong data-start="3277" data-end="3307">What is Elastic Beanstalk?</strong><br data-start="3307" data-end="3310">
<em data-start="3313" data-end="3375">PaaS to quickly deploy apps without managing infrastructure.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3377" data-end="3479" class="">
<p data-start="3381" data-end="3479" class=""><strong data-start="3381" data-end="3412">What is AWS CloudFormation?</strong><br data-start="3412" data-end="3415">
<em data-start="3418" data-end="3479">Infrastructure as Code – defines resources in YAML or JSON.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="3481" data-end="3484" class="">
<h3 data-start="3486" data-end="3519" class=""><strong data-start="3490" data-end="3519">Advanced/Enterprise Level</strong></h3>
<ol start="31" data-start="3521" data-end="4549">
<li data-start="3521" data-end="3600" class="">
<p data-start="3525" data-end="3600" class=""><strong data-start="3525" data-end="3541">What is ECS?</strong><br data-start="3541" data-end="3544">
<em data-start="3547" data-end="3600">Elastic Container Service – runs Docker containers.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3602" data-end="3691" class="">
<p data-start="3606" data-end="3691" class=""><strong data-start="3606" data-end="3622">What is EKS?</strong><br data-start="3622" data-end="3625">
<em data-start="3628" data-end="3691">Elastic Kubernetes Service – fully managed Kubernetes on AWS.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3693" data-end="3786" class="">
<p data-start="3697" data-end="3786" class=""><strong data-start="3697" data-end="3732">Difference between ECS and EKS?</strong><br data-start="3732" data-end="3735">
<em data-start="3738" data-end="3786">ECS is AWS-native; EKS is standard Kubernetes.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3788" data-end="3877" class="">
<p data-start="3792" data-end="3877" class=""><strong data-start="3792" data-end="3812">What is Fargate?</strong><br data-start="3812" data-end="3815">
<em data-start="3818" data-end="3877">Serverless compute engine for containers with ECS or EKS.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="3879" data-end="4013" class="">
<p data-start="3883" data-end="4013" class=""><strong data-start="3883" data-end="3926">How does IAM role differ from IAM user?</strong><br data-start="3926" data-end="3929">
<em data-start="3932" data-end="4013">Role: temporary permissions for resources. User: credentials with fixed access.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4015" data-end="4123" class="">
<p data-start="4019" data-end="4123" class=""><strong data-start="4019" data-end="4054">What is an S3 lifecycle policy?</strong><br data-start="4054" data-end="4057">
<em data-start="4060" data-end="4123">Automates object transitions (e.g., to Glacier) or deletions.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4125" data-end="4214" class="">
<p data-start="4129" data-end="4214" class=""><strong data-start="4129" data-end="4156">What is a Bastion Host?</strong><br data-start="4156" data-end="4159">
<em data-start="4162" data-end="4214">Used to securely connect to private EC2 instances.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4216" data-end="4335" class="">
<p data-start="4220" data-end="4335" class=""><strong data-start="4220" data-end="4264">What is the Shared Responsibility Model?</strong><br data-start="4264" data-end="4267">
<em data-start="4270" data-end="4335">AWS: security <strong data-start="4285" data-end="4291">of</strong> the cloud; You: security <strong data-start="4317" data-end="4323">in</strong> the cloud.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4337" data-end="4440" class="">
<p data-start="4341" data-end="4440" class=""><strong data-start="4341" data-end="4369">What is Multi-AZ in RDS?</strong><br data-start="4369" data-end="4372">
<em data-start="4375" data-end="4440">Provides high availability by replicating the DB to another AZ.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4442" data-end="4549" class="">
<p data-start="4446" data-end="4549" class=""><strong data-start="4446" data-end="4478">What is Read Replica in RDS?</strong><br data-start="4478" data-end="4481">
<em data-start="4484" data-end="4549">Improves read performance by creating read-only copies of a DB.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="4551" data-end="4554" class="">
<h3 data-start="4556" data-end="4592" class=""><strong data-start="4560" data-end="4592">Security &amp; Cost Optimization</strong></h3>
<ol start="41" data-start="4594" data-end="5113">
<li data-start="4594" data-end="4675" class="">
<p data-start="4598" data-end="4675" class=""><strong data-start="4598" data-end="4618">What is AWS KMS?</strong><br data-start="4618" data-end="4621">
<em data-start="4624" data-end="4675">Key Management Service – manages encryption keys.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4677" data-end="4793" class="">
<p data-start="4681" data-end="4793" class=""><strong data-start="4681" data-end="4710">How to secure S3 buckets?</strong><br data-start="4710" data-end="4713">
<em data-start="4716" data-end="4793">Use bucket policies, block public access, enable encryption, use IAM roles.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4795" data-end="4898" class="">
<p data-start="4799" data-end="4898" class=""><strong data-start="4799" data-end="4831">What are Reserved Instances?</strong><br data-start="4831" data-end="4834">
<em data-start="4837" data-end="4898">Prepaid EC2 instances for 1 or 3 years at discounted rates.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="4900" data-end="5004" class="">
<p data-start="4904" data-end="5004" class=""><strong data-start="4904" data-end="4930">What is Spot Instance?</strong><br data-start="4930" data-end="4933">
<em data-start="4936" data-end="5004">EC2 instances offered at a discount but can be terminated anytime.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5006" data-end="5113" class="">
<p data-start="5010" data-end="5113" class=""><strong data-start="5010" data-end="5040">What is a Trusted Advisor?</strong><br data-start="5040" data-end="5043">
<em data-start="5046" data-end="5113">Recommends cost optimization, performance, security improvements.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5115" data-end="5118" class="">
<h3 data-start="5120" data-end="5150" class=""><strong data-start="5124" data-end="5150">Scenarios / Real World</strong></h3>
<ol start="46" data-start="5152" data-end="5767">
<li data-start="5152" data-end="5283" class="">
<p data-start="5156" data-end="5283" class=""><strong data-start="5156" data-end="5204">How would you migrate an on-prem app to AWS?</strong><br data-start="5204" data-end="5207">
<em data-start="5210" data-end="5283">Lift &amp; shift (EC2), refactor (EKS, Lambda), or containerize and deploy.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5285" data-end="5378" class="">
<p data-start="5289" data-end="5378" class=""><strong data-start="5289" data-end="5333">How to handle high availability for EC2?</strong><br data-start="5333" data-end="5336">
<em data-start="5339" data-end="5378">Use ASG across multiple AZs with ELB.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5380" data-end="5478" class="">
<p data-start="5384" data-end="5478" class=""><strong data-start="5384" data-end="5419">How to automate backups in AWS?</strong><br data-start="5419" data-end="5422">
<em data-start="5425" data-end="5478">Use AWS Backup, Lambda cron jobs, or RDS snapshots.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5480" data-end="5617" class="">
<p data-start="5484" data-end="5617" class=""><strong data-start="5484" data-end="5543">How do you monitor a microservices architecture in AWS?</strong><br data-start="5543" data-end="5546">
<em data-start="5549" data-end="5617">Use CloudWatch, X-Ray, Service Lens, and container-specific tools.</em></p>
</li>
<li data-start="5619" data-end="5767" class="">
<p data-start="5623" data-end="5767" class=""><strong data-start="5623" data-end="5664">How do you ensure scalability in AWS?</strong><br data-start="5664" data-end="5667">
<em data-start="5670" data-end="5767">Auto Scaling, load balancing, decoupled architecture with SQS, serverless services like Lambda.</em></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="5769" data-end="5772" class="">
<p data-start="5774" data-end="5912" class="">Need help with specific AWS services like EKS, CI/CD pipeline, or deployment examples for Spring Boot or microservices?
